"2754",35,"feel for the studs over which these fitted. One, indeed, they almost"
"2755",35,"got away from me. As it slipped from my hand, I had to butt in the dark"
"2756",35,"with my head—I could hear the Morlock’s skull ring—to recover it. It"
"2757",35,"was a nearer thing than the fight in the forest, I think, this last"
"2758",35,"scramble."
"2759",35,""
"2760",35,"“But at last the lever was fixed and pulled over. The clinging hands"
"2761",35,"slipped from me. The darkness presently fell from my eyes. I found"
"2762",35,"myself in the same grey light and tumult I have already described."
"2763",35,""
"2764",35,""
"2765",35,""
"2766",35,""
"2767",35," XIV."
"2768",35," The Further Vision"
"2769",35,""
"2770",35,""
"2771",35,"“I have already told you of the sickness and confusion that comes with"
"2772",35,"time travelling. And this time I was not seated properly in the saddle,"
"2773",35,"but sideways and in an unstable fashion. For an indefinite time I clung"
"2774",35,"to the machine as it swayed and vibrated, quite unheeding how I went,"
"2775",35,"and when I brought myself to look at the dials again I was amazed to"
"2776",35,"find where I had arrived. One dial records days, and another thousands"
"2777",35,"of days, another millions of days, and another thousands of millions."
"2778",35,"Now, instead of reversing the levers, I had pulled them over so as to"
"2779",35,"go forward with them, and when I came to look at these indicators I"
"2780",35,"found that the thousands hand was sweeping round as fast as the seconds"
"2781",35,"hand of a watch—into futurity."
"2782",35,""
"2783",35,"“As I drove on, a peculiar change crept over the appearance of things."
"2784",35,"The palpitating greyness grew darker; then—though I was still"
"2785",35,"travelling with prodigious velocity—the blinking succession of day and"
"2786",35,"night, which was usually indicative of a slower pace, returned, and"
"2787",35,"grew more and more marked. This puzzled me very much at first. The"
"2788",35,"alternations of night and day grew slower and slower, and so did the"
"2789",35,"passage of the sun across the sky, until they seemed to stretch through"
"2790",35,"centuries. At last a steady twilight brooded over the earth, a twilight"
"2791",35,"only broken now and then when a comet glared across the darkling sky."
"2792",35,"The band of light that had indicated the sun had long since"
"2793",35,"disappeared; for the sun had ceased to set—it simply rose and fell in"
"2794",35,"the west, and grew ever broader and more red. All trace of the moon had"
"2795",35,"vanished. The circling of the stars, growing slower and slower, had"
"2796",35,"given place to creeping points of light. At last, some time before I"
"2797",35,"stopped, the sun, red and very large, halted motionless upon the"
"2798",35,"horizon, a vast dome glowing with a dull heat, and now and then"
"2799",35,"suffering a momentary extinction. At one time it had for a little while"
"2800",35,"glowed more brilliantly again, but it speedily reverted to its sullen"
"2801",35,"red heat. I perceived by this slowing down of its rising and setting"
"2802",35,"that the work of the tidal drag was done. The earth had come to rest"
"2803",35,"with one face to the sun, even as in our own time the moon faces the"
"2804",35,"earth. Very cautiously, for I remembered my former headlong fall, I"
"2805",35,"began to reverse my motion. Slower and slower went the circling hands"
"2806",35,"until the thousands one seemed motionless and the daily one was no"
"2807",35,"longer a mere mist upon its scale. Still slower, until the dim outlines"
"2808",35,"of a desolate beach grew visible."
"2809",35,""
"2810",35,"“I stopped very gently and sat upon the Time Machine, looking round."
"2811",35,"The sky was no longer blue. North-eastward it was inky black, and out"
"2812",35,"of the blackness shone brightly and steadily the pale white stars."
"2813",35,"Overhead it was a deep Indian red and starless, and south-eastward it"
"2814",35,"grew brighter to a glowing scarlet where, cut by the horizon, lay the"
"2815",35,"huge hull of the sun, red and motionless. The rocks about me were of a"
"2816",35,"harsh reddish colour, and all the trace of life that I could see at"
"2817",35,"first was the intensely green vegetation that covered every projecting"
"2818",35,"point on their south-eastern face. It was the same rich green that one"
"2819",35,"sees on forest moss or on the lichen in caves: plants which like these"
"2820",35,"grow in a perpetual twilight."
"2821",35,""
"2822",35,"“The machine was standing on a sloping beach. The sea stretched away to"
"2823",35,"the south-west, to rise into a sharp bright horizon against the wan"
"2824",35,"sky. There were no breakers and no waves, for not a breath of wind was"
"2825",35,"stirring. Only a slight oily swell rose and fell like a gentle"
"2826",35,"breathing, and showed that the eternal sea was still moving and living."
"2827",35,"And along the margin where the water sometimes broke was a thick"
"2828",35,"incrustation of salt—pink under the lurid sky. There was a sense of"
"2829",35,"oppression in my head, and I noticed that I was breathing very fast."
"2830",35,"The sensation reminded me of my only experience of mountaineering, and"
"2831",35,"from that I judged the air to be more rarefied than it is now."
"2832",35,""
"2833",35,"“Far away up the desolate slope I heard a harsh scream, and saw a thing"
"2834",35,"like a huge white butterfly go slanting and fluttering up into the sky"
"2835",35,"and, circling, disappear over some low hillocks beyond. The sound of"
"2836",35,"its voice was so dismal that I shivered and seated myself more firmly"
"2837",35,"upon the machine. Looking round me again, I saw that, quite near, what"
"2838",35,"I had taken to be a reddish mass of rock was moving slowly towards me."
"2839",35,"Then I saw the thing was really a monstrous crab-like creature. Can you"
"2840",35,"imagine a crab as large as yonder table, with its many legs moving"
"2841",35,"slowly and uncertainly, its big claws swaying, its long antennæ, like"
"2842",35,"carters’ whips, waving and feeling, and its stalked eyes gleaming at"
"2843",35,"you on either side of its metallic front? Its back was corrugated and"
"2844",35,"ornamented with ungainly bosses, and a greenish incrustation blotched"
"2845",35,"it here and there. I could see the many palps of its complicated mouth"
"2846",35,"flickering and feeling as it moved."
"2847",35,""
"2848",35,"“As I stared at this sinister apparition crawling towards me, I felt a"
"2849",35,"tickling on my cheek as though a fly had lighted there. I tried to"
"2850",35,"brush it away with my hand, but in a moment it returned, and almost"
"2851",35,"immediately came another by my ear. I struck at this, and caught"
"2852",35,"something threadlike. It was drawn swiftly out of my hand. With a"
"2853",35,"frightful qualm, I turned, and I saw that I had grasped the antenna of"
"2854",35,"another monster crab that stood just behind me. Its evil eyes were"
"2855",35,"wriggling on their stalks, its mouth was all alive with appetite, and"
"2856",35,"its vast ungainly claws, smeared with an algal slime, were descending"
"2857",35,"upon me. In a moment my hand was on the lever, and I had placed a month"
"2858",35,"between myself and these monsters. But I was still on the same beach,"
"2859",35,"and I saw them distinctly now as soon as I stopped. Dozens of them"
"2860",35,"seemed to be crawling here and there, in the sombre light, among the"
"2861",35,"foliated sheets of intense green."
"2862",35,""
"2863",35,"“I cannot convey the sense of abominable desolation that hung over the"
"2864",35,"world. The red eastern sky, the northward blackness, the salt Dead Sea,"
"2865",35,"the stony beach crawling with these foul, slow-stirring monsters, the"
"2866",35,"uniform poisonous-looking green of the lichenous plants, the thin air"
"2867",35,"that hurts one’s lungs: all contributed to an appalling effect. I moved"
"2868",35,"on a hundred years, and there was the same red sun—a little larger, a"
"2869",35,"little duller—the same dying sea, the same chill air, and the same"
"2870",35,"crowd of earthy crustacea creeping in and out among the green weed and"
"2871",35,"the red rocks. And in the westward sky, I saw a curved pale line like a"
"2872",35,"vast new moon."
"2873",35,""
"2874",35,"“So I travelled, stopping ever and again, in great strides of a"
"2875",35,"thousand years or more, drawn on by the mystery of the earth’s fate,"
"2876",35,"watching with a strange fascination the sun grow larger and duller in"
"2877",35,"the westward sky, and the life of the old earth ebb away. At last, more"
"2878",35,"than thirty million years hence, the huge red-hot dome of the sun had"
"2879",35,"come to obscure nearly a tenth part of the darkling heavens. Then I"
"2880",35,"stopped once more, for the crawling multitude of crabs had disappeared,"
"2881",35,"and the red beach, save for its livid green liverworts and lichens,"
"2882",35,"seemed lifeless. And now it was flecked with white. A bitter cold"
"2883",35,"assailed me. Rare white flakes ever and again came eddying down. To the"
"2884",35,"north-eastward, the glare of snow lay under the starlight of the sable"
"2885",35,"sky, and I could see an undulating crest of hillocks pinkish white."
"2886",35,"There were fringes of ice along the sea margin, with drifting masses"
"2887",35,"farther out; but the main expanse of that salt ocean, all bloody under"
"2888",35,"the eternal sunset, was still unfrozen."
"2889",35,""
"2890",35,"“I looked about me to see if any traces of animal life remained. A"
"2891",35,"certain indefinable apprehension still kept me in the saddle of the"
"2892",35,"machine. But I saw nothing moving, in earth or sky or sea. The green"
"2893",35,"slime on the rocks alone testified that life was not extinct. A shallow"
"2894",35,"sandbank had appeared in the sea and the water had receded from the"
"2895",35,"beach. I fancied I saw some black object flopping about upon this bank,"
"2896",35,"but it became motionless as I looked at it, and I judged that my eye"
"2897",35,"had been deceived, and that the black object was merely a rock. The"
"2898",35,"stars in the sky were intensely bright and seemed to me to twinkle very"
"2899",35,"little."
"2900",35,""
"2901",35,"“Suddenly I noticed that the circular westward outline of the sun had"
"2902",35,"changed; that a concavity, a bay, had appeared in the curve. I saw this"
"2903",35,"grow larger. For a minute perhaps I stared aghast at this blackness"
"2904",35,"that was creeping over the day, and then I realised that an eclipse was"
"2905",35,"beginning. Either the moon or the planet Mercury was passing across the"
"2906",35,"sun’s disk. Naturally, at first I took it to be the moon, but there is"
"2907",35,"much to incline me to believe that what I really saw was the transit of"
"2908",35,"an inner planet passing very near to the earth."
"2909",35,""
"2910",35,"“The darkness grew apace; a cold wind began to blow in freshening gusts"
"2911",35,"from the east, and the showering white flakes in the air increased in"
"2912",35,"number. From the edge of the sea came a ripple and whisper. Beyond"
"2913",35,"these lifeless sounds the world was silent. Silent? It would be hard to"
"2914",35,"convey the stillness of it. All the sounds of man, the bleating of"
"2915",35,"sheep, the cries of birds, the hum of insects, the stir that makes the"
"2916",35,"background of our lives—all that was over. As the darkness thickened,"
"2917",35,"the eddying flakes grew more abundant, dancing before my eyes; and the"
"2918",35,"cold of the air more intense. At last, one by one, swiftly, one after"
"2919",35,"the other, the white peaks of the distant hills vanished into"
"2920",35,"blackness. The breeze rose to a moaning wind. I saw the black central"
"2921",35,"shadow of the eclipse sweeping towards me. In another moment the pale"
"2922",35,"stars alone were visible. All else was rayless obscurity. The sky was"
"2923",35,"absolutely black."
"2924",35,""
"2925",35,"“A horror of this great darkness came on me. The cold, that smote to my"
"2926",35,"marrow, and the pain I felt in breathing, overcame me. I shivered, and"
"2927",35,"a deadly nausea seized me. Then like a red-hot bow in the sky appeared"
"2928",35,"the edge of the sun. I got off the machine to recover myself. I felt"
"2929",35,"giddy and incapable of facing the return journey. As I stood sick and"
"2930",35,"confused I saw again the moving thing upon the shoal—there was no"
"2931",35,"mistake now that it was a moving thing—against the red water of the"
"2932",35,"sea. It was a round thing, the size of a football perhaps, or, it may"
"2933",35,"be, bigger, and tentacles trailed down from it; it seemed black against"
"2934",35,"the weltering blood-red water, and it was hopping fitfully about. Then"
"2935",35,"I felt I was fainting. But a terrible dread of lying helpless in that"
"2936",35,"remote and awful twilight sustained me while I clambered upon the"
"2937",35,"saddle."
"2938",35,""
"2939",35,""
"2940",35,""
"2941",35,""
"2942",35," XV."
"2943",35," The Time Traveller’s Return"
"2944",35,""
"2945",35,""
"2946",35,"“So I came back. For a long time I must have been insensible upon the"
"2947",35,"machine. The blinking succession of the days and nights was resumed,"
"2948",35,"the sun got golden again, the sky blue. I breathed with greater"
"2949",35,"freedom. The fluctuating contours of the land ebbed and flowed. The"
"2950",35,"hands spun backward upon the dials. At last I saw again the dim shadows"
"2951",35,"of houses, the evidences of decadent humanity. These, too, changed and"
"2952",35,"passed, and others came. Presently, when the million dial was at zero,"
"2953",35,"I slackened speed. I began to recognise our own pretty and familiar"
"2954",35,"architecture, the thousands hand ran back to the starting-point, the"
"2955",35,"night and day flapped slower and slower. Then the old walls of the"
"2956",35,"laboratory came round me. Very gently, now, I slowed the mechanism"
"2957",35,"down."
"2958",35,""
"2959",35,"“I saw one little thing that seemed odd to me. I think I have told you"
"2960",35,"that when I set out, before my velocity became very high, Mrs. Watchett"
"2961",35,"had walked across the room, travelling, as it seemed to me, like a"
"2962",35,"rocket. As I returned, I passed again across that minute when she"
"2963",35,"traversed the laboratory. But now her every motion appeared to be the"
"2964",35,"exact inversion of her previous ones. The door at the lower end opened,"
"2965",35,"and she glided quietly up the laboratory, back foremost, and"
"2966",35,"disappeared behind the door by which she had previously entered. Just"
"2967",35,"before that I seemed to see Hillyer for a moment; but he passed like a"
"2968",35,"flash."
"2969",35,""
"2970",35,"“Then I stopped the machine, and saw about me again the old familiar"
"2971",35,"laboratory, my tools, my appliances just as I had left them. I got off"
"2972",35,"the thing very shakily, and sat down upon my bench. For several minutes"
"2973",35,"I trembled violently. Then I became calmer. Around me was my old"
"2974",35,"workshop again, exactly as it had been. I might have slept there, and"
"2975",35,"the whole thing have been a dream."
"2976",35,""
"2977",35,"“And yet, not exactly! The thing had started from the south-east corner"
"2978",35,"of the laboratory. It had come to rest again in the north-west, against"
"2979",35,"the wall where you saw it. That gives you the exact distance from my"
"2980",35,"little lawn to the pedestal of the White Sphinx, into which the"
"2981",35,"Morlocks had carried my machine."
"2982",35,""
"2983",35,"“For a time my brain went stagnant. Presently I got up and came through"
"2984",35,"the passage here, limping, because my heel was still painful, and"
"2985",35,"feeling sorely begrimed. I saw the _Pall Mall Gazette_ on the table by"
"2986",35,"the door. I found the date was indeed today, and looking at the"
"2987",35,"timepiece, saw the hour was almost eight o’clock. I heard your voices"
"2988",35,"and the clatter of plates. I hesitated—I felt so sick and weak. Then I"
"2989",35,"sniffed good wholesome meat, and opened the door on you. You know the"
"2990",35,"rest. I washed, and dined, and now I am telling you the story."
"2991",35,""
"2992",35,""
"2993",35,""
"2994",35,""
"2995",35," XVI."
"2996",35," After the Story"
"2997",35,""
"2998",35,""
"2999",35,"“I know,” he said, after a pause, “that all this will be absolutely"
"3000",35,"incredible to you, but to me the one incredible thing is that I am here"
"3001",35,"tonight in this old familiar room looking into your friendly faces and"
"3002",35,"telling you these strange adventures.” He looked at the Medical Man."
"3003",35,"“No. I cannot expect you to believe it. Take it as a lie—or a prophecy."
"3004",35,"Say I dreamed it in the workshop. Consider I have been speculating upon"
"3005",35,"the destinies of our race, until I have hatched this fiction. Treat my"
"3006",35,"assertion of its truth as a mere stroke of art to enhance its interest."
"3007",35,"And taking it as a story, what do you think of it?”"
"3008",35,""
"3009",35,"He took up his pipe, and began, in his old accustomed manner, to tap"
"3010",35,"with it nervously upon the bars of the grate. There was a momentary"
"3011",35,"stillness. Then chairs began to creak and shoes to scrape upon the"
"3012",35,"carpet. I took my eyes off the Time Traveller’s face, and looked round"
"3013",35,"at his audience. They were in the dark, and little spots of colour swam"
"3014",35,"before them. The Medical Man seemed absorbed in the contemplation of"
"3015",35,"our host. The Editor was looking hard at the end of his cigar—the"
"3016",35,"sixth. The Journalist fumbled for his watch. The others, as far as I"
"3017",35,"remember, were motionless."
"3018",35,""
"3019",35,"The Editor stood up with a sigh. “What a pity it is you’re not a writer"
"3020",35,"of stories!” he said, putting his hand on the Time Traveller’s"
"3021",35,"shoulder."
"3022",35,""
"3023",35,"“You don’t believe it?”"
"3024",35,""
"3025",35,"“Well——”"
"3026",35,""
"3027",35,"“I thought not.”"
"3028",35,""
"3029",35,"The Time Traveller turned to us. “Where are the matches?” he said. He"
"3030",35,"lit one and spoke over his pipe, puffing. “To tell you the truth... I"
"3031",35,"hardly believe it myself..... And yet...”"
"3032",35,""
"3033",35,"His eye fell with a mute inquiry upon the withered white flowers upon"
"3034",35,"the little table. Then he turned over the hand holding his pipe, and I"
"3035",35,"saw he was looking at some half-healed scars on his knuckles."
"3036",35,""
"3037",35,"The Medical Man rose, came to the lamp, and examined the flowers. “The"
"3038",35,"gynæceum’s odd,” he said. The Psychologist leant forward to see,"
"3039",35,"holding out his hand for a specimen."
"3040",35,""
"3041",35,"“I’m hanged if it isn’t a quarter to one,” said the Journalist. “How"
"3042",35,"shall we get home?”"
"3043",35,""
"3044",35,"“Plenty of cabs at the station,” said the Psychologist."
"3045",35,""
"3046",35,"“It’s a curious thing,” said the Medical Man; “but I certainly don’t"
"3047",35,"know the natural order of these flowers. May I have them?”"
"3048",35,""
"3049",35,"The Time Traveller hesitated. Then suddenly: “Certainly not.”"
"3050",35,""
"3051",35,"“Where did you really get them?” said the Medical Man."
"3052",35,""
"3053",35,"The Time Traveller put his hand to his head. He spoke like one who was"
"3054",35,"trying to keep hold of an idea that eluded him. “They were put into my"
"3055",35,"pocket by Weena, when I travelled into Time.” He stared round the room."
"3056",35,"“I’m damned if it isn’t all going. This room and you and the atmosphere"
"3057",35,"of every day is too much for my memory. Did I ever make a Time Machine,"
"3058",35,"or a model of a Time Machine? Or is it all only a dream? They say life"
"3059",35,"is a dream, a precious poor dream at times—but I can’t stand another"
"3060",35,"that won’t fit. It’s madness. And where did the dream come from? … I"
"3061",35,"must look at that machine. If there is one!”"
"3062",35,""
"3063",35,"He caught up the lamp swiftly, and carried it, flaring red, through the"
"3064",35,"door into the corridor. We followed him. There in the flickering light"
"3065",35,"of the lamp was the machine sure enough, squat, ugly, and askew, a"
"3066",35,"thing of brass, ebony, ivory, and translucent glimmering quartz. Solid"
"3067",35,"to the touch—for I put out my hand and felt the rail of it—and with"
"3068",35,"brown spots and smears upon the ivory, and bits of grass and moss upon"
"3069",35,"the lower parts, and one rail bent awry."
"3070",35,""
"3071",35,"The Time Traveller put the lamp down on the bench, and ran his hand"
"3072",35,"along the damaged rail. “It’s all right now,” he said. “The story I"
"3073",35,"told you was true. I’m sorry to have brought you out here in the cold.”"
"3074",35,"He took up the lamp, and, in an absolute silence, we returned to the"
"3075",35,"smoking-room."
"3076",35,""
"3077",35,"He came into the hall with us and helped the Editor on with his coat."
"3078",35,"The Medical Man looked into his face and, with a certain hesitation,"
"3079",35,"told him he was suffering from overwork, at which he laughed hugely. I"
"3080",35,"remember him standing in the open doorway, bawling good-night."
"3081",35,""
"3082",35,"I shared a cab with the Editor. He thought the tale a “gaudy lie.” For"
"3083",35,"my own part I was unable to come to a conclusion. The story was so"
"3084",35,"fantastic and incredible, the telling so credible and sober. I lay"
"3085",35,"awake most of the night thinking about it. I determined to go next day"
"3086",35,"and see the Time Traveller again. I was told he was in the laboratory,"
"3087",35,"and being on easy terms in the house, I went up to him. The laboratory,"
"3088",35,"however, was empty. I stared for a minute at the Time Machine and put"
"3089",35,"out my hand and touched the lever. At that the squat"
"3090",35,"substantial-looking mass swayed like a bough shaken by the wind. Its"
"3091",35,"instability startled me extremely, and I had a queer reminiscence of"
"3092",35,"the childish days when I used to be forbidden to meddle. I came back"
"3093",35,"through the corridor. The Time Traveller met me in the smoking-room. He"
"3094",35,"was coming from the house. He had a small camera under one arm and a"
"3095",35,"knapsack under the other. He laughed when he saw me, and gave me an"
"3096",35,"elbow to shake. “I’m frightfully busy,” said he, “with that thing in"
"3097",35,"there.”"
"3098",35,""
"3099",35,"“But is it not some hoax?” I said. “Do you really travel through time?”"
"3100",35,""
"3101",35,"“Really and truly I do.” And he looked frankly into my eyes. He"
"3102",35,"hesitated. His eye wandered about the room. “I only want half an hour,”"
"3103",35,"he said. “I know why you came, and it’s awfully good of you. There’s"
"3104",35,"some magazines here. If you’ll stop to lunch I’ll prove you this time"
"3105",35,"travelling up to the hilt, specimens and all. If you’ll forgive my"
"3106",35,"leaving you now?”"
"3107",35,""
"3108",35,"I consented, hardly comprehending then the full import of his words,"
"3109",35,"and he nodded and went on down the corridor. I heard the door of the"
"3110",35,"laboratory slam, seated myself in a chair, and took up a daily paper."
"3111",35,"What was he going to do before lunch-time? Then suddenly I was reminded"
"3112",35,"by an advertisement that I had promised to meet Richardson, the"
"3113",35,"publisher, at two. I looked at my watch, and saw that I could barely"
"3114",35,"save that engagement. I got up and went down the passage to tell the"
"3115",35,"Time Traveller."
"3116",35,""
"3117",35,"As I took hold of the handle of the door I heard an exclamation, oddly"
"3118",35,"truncated at the end, and a click and a thud. A gust of air whirled"
"3119",35,"round me as I opened the door, and from within came the sound of broken"
"3120",35,"glass falling on the floor. The Time Traveller was not there. I seemed"
"3121",35,"to see a ghostly, indistinct figure sitting in a whirling mass of black"
"3122",35,"and brass for a moment—a figure so transparent that the bench behind"
"3123",35,"with its sheets of drawings was absolutely distinct; but this phantasm"
"3124",35,"vanished as I rubbed my eyes. The Time Machine had gone. Save for a"
"3125",35,"subsiding stir of dust, the further end of the laboratory was empty. A"
"3126",35,"pane of the skylight had, apparently, just been blown in."
"3127",35,""
"3128",35,"I felt an unreasonable amazement. I knew that something strange had"
"3129",35,"happened, and for the moment could not distinguish what the strange"
"3130",35,"thing might be. As I stood staring, the door into the garden opened,"
"3131",35,"and the man-servant appeared."
"3132",35,""
"3133",35,"We looked at each other. Then ideas began to come. “Has Mr. —— gone out"
"3134",35,"that way?” said I."
"3135",35,""
"3136",35,"“No, sir. No one has come out this way. I was expecting to find him"
"3137",35,"here.”"
"3138",35,""
"3139",35,"At that I understood. At the risk of disappointing Richardson I stayed"
"3140",35,"on, waiting for the Time Traveller; waiting for the second, perhaps"
"3141",35,"still stranger story, and the specimens and photographs he would bring"
"3142",35,"with him. But I am beginning now to fear that I must wait a lifetime."
"3143",35,"The Time Traveller vanished three years ago. And, as everybody knows"
"3144",35,"now, he has never returned."
"3145",35,""
"3146",35,""
"3147",35,""
"3148",35,""
"3149",35," Epilogue"
"3150",35,""
"3151",35,""
"3152",35,"One cannot choose but wonder. Will he ever return? It may be that he"
"3153",35,"swept back into the past, and fell among the blood-drinking, hairy"
"3154",35,"savages of the Age of Unpolished Stone; into the abysses of the"
"3155",35,"Cretaceous Sea; or among the grotesque saurians, the huge reptilian"
"3156",35,"brutes of the Jurassic times. He may even now—if I may use the"
"3157",35,"phrase—be wandering on some plesiosaurus-haunted Oolitic coral reef, or"
"3158",35,"beside the lonely saline seas of the Triassic Age. Or did he go"
"3159",35,"forward, into one of the nearer ages, in which men are still men, but"
"3160",35,"with the riddles of our own time answered and its wearisome problems"
"3161",35,"solved? Into the manhood of the race: for I, for my own part, cannot"
"3162",35,"think that these latter days of weak experiment, fragmentary theory,"
"3163",35,"and mutual discord are indeed man’s culminating time! I say, for my own"
"3164",35,"part. He, I know—for the question had been discussed among us long"
"3165",35,"before the Time Machine was made—thought but cheerlessly of the"
"3166",35,"Advancement of Mankind, and saw in the growing pile of civilisation"
"3167",35,"only a foolish heaping that must inevitably fall back upon and destroy"
"3168",35,"its makers in the end. If that is so, it remains for us to live as"
"3169",35,"though it were not so. But to me the future is still black and blank—is"
"3170",35,"a vast ignorance, lit at a few casual places by the memory of his"
"3171",35,"story. And I have by me, for my comfort, two strange white"
"3172",35,"flowers—shrivelled now, and brown and flat and brittle—to witness that"
"3173",35,"even when mind and strength had gone, gratitude and a mutual tenderness"
"3174",35,"still lived on in the heart of man."
