"5758",36,"Coming out, he bought a _Referee_. He became alarmed at the news in"
"5759",36,"this, and went again to Waterloo station to find out if communication"
"5760",36,"were restored. The omnibuses, carriages, cyclists, and innumerable"
"5761",36,"people walking in their best clothes seemed scarcely affected by the"
"5762",36,"strange intelligence that the newsvendors were disseminating. People"
"5763",36,"were interested, or, if alarmed, alarmed only on account of the local"
"5764",36,"residents. At the station he heard for the first time that the Windsor"
"5765",36,"and Chertsey lines were now interrupted. The porters told him that"
"5766",36,"several remarkable telegrams had been received in the morning from"
"5767",36,"Byfleet and Chertsey stations, but that these had abruptly ceased. My"
"5768",36,"brother could get very little precise detail out of them."
"5769",36,""
"5770",36,"“There’s fighting going on about Weybridge” was the extent of their"
"5771",36,"information."
"5772",36,""
"5773",36,"The train service was now very much disorganised. Quite a number of"
"5774",36,"people who had been expecting friends from places on the South-Western"
"5775",36,"network were standing about the station. One grey-headed old gentleman"
"5776",36,"came and abused the South-Western Company bitterly to my brother. “It"
"5777",36,"wants showing up,” he said."
"5778",36,""
"5779",36,"One or two trains came in from Richmond, Putney, and Kingston,"
"5780",36,"containing people who had gone out for a day’s boating and found the"
"5781",36,"locks closed and a feeling of panic in the air. A man in a blue and"
"5782",36,"white blazer addressed my brother, full of strange tidings."
"5783",36,""
"5784",36,"“There’s hosts of people driving into Kingston in traps and carts and"
"5785",36,"things, with boxes of valuables and all that,” he said. “They come from"
"5786",36,"Molesey and Weybridge and Walton, and they say there’s been guns heard"
"5787",36,"at Chertsey, heavy firing, and that mounted soldiers have told them to"
"5788",36,"get off at once because the Martians are coming. We heard guns firing"
"5789",36,"at Hampton Court station, but we thought it was thunder. What the"
"5790",36,"dickens does it all mean? The Martians can’t get out of their pit, can"
"5791",36,"they?”"
"5792",36,""
"5793",36,"My brother could not tell him."
"5794",36,""
"5795",36,"Afterwards he found that the vague feeling of alarm had spread to the"
"5796",36,"clients of the underground railway, and that the Sunday excursionists"
"5797",36,"began to return from all over the South-Western “lung”—Barnes,"
"5798",36,"Wimbledon, Richmond Park, Kew, and so forth—at unnaturally early hours;"
"5799",36,"but not a soul had anything more than vague hearsay to tell of."
"5800",36,"Everyone connected with the terminus seemed ill-tempered."
"5801",36,""
"5802",36,"About five o’clock the gathering crowd in the station was immensely"
"5803",36,"excited by the opening of the line of communication, which is almost"
"5804",36,"invariably closed, between the South-Eastern and the South-Western"
"5805",36,"stations, and the passage of carriage trucks bearing huge guns and"
"5806",36,"carriages crammed with soldiers. These were the guns that were brought"
"5807",36,"up from Woolwich and Chatham to cover Kingston. There was an exchange"
"5808",36,"of pleasantries: “You’ll get eaten!” “We’re the beast-tamers!” and so"
"5809",36,"forth. A little while after that a squad of police came into the"
"5810",36,"station and began to clear the public off the platforms, and my brother"
"5811",36,"went out into the street again."
"5812",36,""
"5813",36,"The church bells were ringing for evensong, and a squad of Salvation"
"5814",36,"Army lassies came singing down Waterloo Road. On the bridge a number of"
"5815",36,"loafers were watching a curious brown scum that came drifting down the"
"5816",36,"stream in patches. The sun was just setting, and the Clock Tower and"
"5817",36,"the Houses of Parliament rose against one of the most peaceful skies it"
"5818",36,"is possible to imagine, a sky of gold, barred with long transverse"
"5819",36,"stripes of reddish-purple cloud. There was talk of a floating body. One"
"5820",36,"of the men there, a reservist he said he was, told my brother he had"
"5821",36,"seen the heliograph flickering in the west."
"5822",36,""
"5823",36,"In Wellington Street my brother met a couple of sturdy roughs who had"
"5824",36,"just been rushed out of Fleet Street with still-wet newspapers and"
"5825",36,"staring placards. “Dreadful catastrophe!” they bawled one to the other"
"5826",36,"down Wellington Street. “Fighting at Weybridge! Full description!"
"5827",36,"Repulse of the Martians! London in Danger!” He had to give threepence"
"5828",36,"for a copy of that paper."
"5829",36,""
"5830",36,"Then it was, and then only, that he realised something of the full"
"5831",36,"power and terror of these monsters. He learned that they were not"
"5832",36,"merely a handful of small sluggish creatures, but that they were minds"
"5833",36,"swaying vast mechanical bodies; and that they could move swiftly and"
"5834",36,"smite with such power that even the mightiest guns could not stand"
"5835",36,"against them."
"5836",36,""
"5837",36,"They were described as “vast spiderlike machines, nearly a hundred feet"
"5838",36,"high, capable of the speed of an express train, and able to shoot out a"
"5839",36,"beam of intense heat.” Masked batteries, chiefly of field guns, had"
"5840",36,"been planted in the country about Horsell Common, and especially"
"5841",36,"between the Woking district and London. Five of the machines had been"
"5842",36,"seen moving towards the Thames, and one, by a happy chance, had been"
"5843",36,"destroyed. In the other cases the shells had missed, and the batteries"
"5844",36,"had been at once annihilated by the Heat-Rays. Heavy losses of soldiers"
"5845",36,"were mentioned, but the tone of the dispatch was optimistic."
"5846",36,""
"5847",36,"The Martians had been repulsed; they were not invulnerable. They had"
"5848",36,"retreated to their triangle of cylinders again, in the circle about"
"5849",36,"Woking. Signallers with heliographs were pushing forward upon them from"
"5850",36,"all sides. Guns were in rapid transit from Windsor, Portsmouth,"
"5851",36,"Aldershot, Woolwich—even from the north; among others, long wire-guns"
"5852",36,"of ninety-five tons from Woolwich. Altogether one hundred and sixteen"
"5853",36,"were in position or being hastily placed, chiefly covering London."
"5854",36,"Never before in England had there been such a vast or rapid"
"5855",36,"concentration of military material."
"5856",36,""
"5857",36,"Any further cylinders that fell, it was hoped, could be destroyed at"
"5858",36,"once by high explosives, which were being rapidly manufactured and"
"5859",36,"distributed. No doubt, ran the report, the situation was of the"
"5860",36,"strangest and gravest description, but the public was exhorted to avoid"
"5861",36,"and discourage panic. No doubt the Martians were strange and terrible"
"5862",36,"in the extreme, but at the outside there could not be more than twenty"
"5863",36,"of them against our millions."
"5864",36,""
"5865",36,"The authorities had reason to suppose, from the size of the cylinders,"
"5866",36,"that at the outside there could not be more than five in each"
"5867",36,"cylinder—fifteen altogether. And one at least was disposed of—perhaps"
"5868",36,"more. The public would be fairly warned of the approach of danger, and"
"5869",36,"elaborate measures were being taken for the protection of the people in"
"5870",36,"the threatened southwestern suburbs. And so, with reiterated assurances"
"5871",36,"of the safety of London and the ability of the authorities to cope with"
"5872",36,"the difficulty, this quasi-proclamation closed."
"5873",36,""
"5874",36,"This was printed in enormous type on paper so fresh that it was still"
"5875",36,"wet, and there had been no time to add a word of comment. It was"
"5876",36,"curious, my brother said, to see how ruthlessly the usual contents of"
"5877",36,"the paper had been hacked and taken out to give this place."
"5878",36,""
"5879",36,"All down Wellington Street people could be seen fluttering out the pink"
"5880",36,"sheets and reading, and the Strand was suddenly noisy with the voices"
"5881",36,"of an army of hawkers following these pioneers. Men came scrambling off"
"5882",36,"buses to secure copies. Certainly this news excited people intensely,"
"5883",36,"whatever their previous apathy. The shutters of a map shop in the"
"5884",36,"Strand were being taken down, my brother said, and a man in his Sunday"
"5885",36,"raiment, lemon-yellow gloves even, was visible inside the window"
"5886",36,"hastily fastening maps of Surrey to the glass."
"5887",36,""
"5888",36,"Going on along the Strand to Trafalgar Square, the paper in his hand,"
"5889",36,"my brother saw some of the fugitives from West Surrey. There was a man"
"5890",36,"with his wife and two boys and some articles of furniture in a cart"
"5891",36,"such as greengrocers use. He was driving from the direction of"
"5892",36,"Westminster Bridge; and close behind him came a hay waggon with five or"
"5893",36,"six respectable-looking people in it, and some boxes and bundles. The"
"5894",36,"faces of these people were haggard, and their entire appearance"
"5895",36,"contrasted conspicuously with the Sabbath-best appearance of the people"
"5896",36,"on the omnibuses. People in fashionable clothing peeped at them out of"
"5897",36,"cabs. They stopped at the Square as if undecided which way to take, and"
"5898",36,"finally turned eastward along the Strand. Some way behind these came a"
"5899",36,"man in workday clothes, riding one of those old-fashioned tricycles"
"5900",36,"with a small front wheel. He was dirty and white in the face."
"5901",36,""
"5902",36,"My brother turned down towards Victoria, and met a number of such"
"5903",36,"people. He had a vague idea that he might see something of me. He"
"5904",36,"noticed an unusual number of police regulating the traffic. Some of the"
"5905",36,"refugees were exchanging news with the people on the omnibuses. One was"
"5906",36,"professing to have seen the Martians. “Boilers on stilts, I tell you,"
"5907",36,"striding along like men.” Most of them were excited and animated by"

"5909",36,""
"5910",36,"Beyond Victoria the public-houses were doing a lively trade with these"
"5911",36,"arrivals. At all the street corners groups of people were reading"
"5912",36,"papers, talking excitedly, or staring at these unusual Sunday visitors."
"5913",36,"They seemed to increase as night drew on, until at last the roads, my"
"5914",36,"brother said, were like Epsom High Street on a Derby Day. My brother"
"5915",36,"addressed several of these fugitives and got unsatisfactory answers"
"5916",36,"from most."
"5917",36,""
"5918",36,"None of them could tell him any news of Woking except one man, who"
"5919",36,"assured him that Woking had been entirely destroyed on the previous"
"5920",36,"night."
"5921",36,""
"5922",36,"“I come from Byfleet,” he said; “a man on a bicycle came through the"
"5923",36,"place in the early morning, and ran from door to door warning us to"
"5924",36,"come away. Then came soldiers. We went out to look, and there were"

"5926",36,"that way. Then we heard the guns at Chertsey, and folks coming from"
"5927",36,"Weybridge. So I’ve locked up my house and come on.”"
"5928",36,""
"5929",36,"At that time there was a strong feeling in the streets that the"
"5930",36,"authorities were to blame for their incapacity to dispose of the"
"5931",36,"invaders without all this inconvenience."
"5932",36,""
"5933",36,"About eight o’clock a noise of heavy firing was distinctly audible all"

"5935",36,"in the main thoroughfares, but by striking through the quiet back"
"5936",36,"streets to the river he was able to distinguish it quite plainly."
"5937",36,""
"5938",36,"He walked from Westminster to his apartments near Regent’s Park, about"
"5939",36,"two. He was now very anxious on my account, and disturbed at the"

"5944",36,""
"5945",36,"There were one or two cartloads of refugees passing along Oxford"

"5954",36,""

"5964",36,""
"5965",36,"His room was an attic and as he thrust his head out, up and down the"
"5966",36,"street there were a dozen echoes to the noise of his window sash, and"
"5967",36,"heads in every kind of night disarray appeared. Enquiries were being"

"5969",36,"“the Martians are coming!” and hurried to the next door."
"5970",36,""
"5971",36,"The sound of drumming and trumpeting came from the Albany Street"
"5972",36,"Barracks, and every church within earshot was hard at work killing"
"5973",36,"sleep with a vehement disorderly tocsin. There was a noise of doors"

"5976",36,""

"5984",36,""

"5991",36,""

"5993",36,""
"5994",36,"They both craned their heads out of the window, straining to hear what"
"5995",36,"the policemen were shouting. People were coming out of the side"
"5996",36,"streets, and standing in groups at the corners talking."
"5997",36,""
"5998",36,"“What the devil is it all about?” said my brother’s fellow lodger."
"5999",36,""
"6000",36,"My brother answered him vaguely and began to dress, running with each"
"6001",36,"garment to the window in order to miss nothing of the growing"
"6002",36,"excitement. And presently men selling unnaturally early newspapers came"
"6003",36,"bawling into the street:"
"6004",36,""
"6005",36,"“London in danger of suffocation! The Kingston and Richmond defences"

"6007",36,""
"6008",36,"And all about him—in the rooms below, in the houses on each side and"
"6009",36,"across the road, and behind in the Park Terraces and in the hundred"
"6010",36,"other streets of that part of Marylebone, and the Westbourne Park"

"6017",36,"was the dawn of the great panic. London, which had gone to bed on"
"6018",36,"Sunday night oblivious and inert, was awakened, in the small hours of"
"6019",36,"Monday morning, to a vivid sense of danger."
"6020",36,""
"6021",36,"Unable from his window to learn what was happening, my brother went"
"6022",36,"down and out into the street, just as the sky between the parapets of"
"6023",36,"the houses grew pink with the early dawn. The flying people on foot and"
"6024",36,"in vehicles grew more numerous every moment. “Black Smoke!” he heard"
"6025",36,"people crying, and again “Black Smoke!” The contagion of such a"
"6026",36,"unanimous fear was inevitable. As my brother hesitated on the"
"6027",36,"door-step, he saw another newsvendor approaching, and got a paper"
"6028",36,"forthwith. The man was running away with the rest, and selling his"
"6029",36,"papers for a shilling each as he ran—a grotesque mingling of profit and"
"6030",36,"panic."
"6031",36,""
"6032",36,"And from this paper my brother read that catastrophic dispatch of the"
"6033",36,"Commander-in-Chief:"
"6034",36,""
"6035",36,"“The Martians are able to discharge enormous clouds of a black and"
"6036",36,"poisonous vapour by means of rockets. They have smothered our"
"6037",36,"batteries, destroyed Richmond, Kingston, and Wimbledon, and are"
"6038",36,"advancing slowly towards London, destroying everything on the way. It"
"6039",36,"is impossible to stop them. There is no safety from the Black Smoke but"
"6040",36,"in instant flight.”"
"6041",36,""
"6042",36,""
"6043",36,"That was all, but it was enough. The whole population of the great"
"6044",36,"six-million city was stirring, slipping, running; presently it would be"
"6045",36,"pouring _en masse_ northward."
"6046",36,""
"6047",36,"“Black Smoke!” the voices cried. “Fire!”"
"6048",36,""
"6049",36,"The bells of the neighbouring church made a jangling tumult, a cart"
"6050",36,"carelessly driven smashed, amid shrieks and curses, against the water"
"6051",36,"trough up the street. Sickly yellow lights went to and fro in the"

"6054",36,""
"6055",36,"He heard footsteps running to and fro in the rooms, and up and down"
"6056",36,"stairs behind him. His landlady came to the door, loosely wrapped in"

"6058",36,""

"6060",36,"turned hastily to his own room, put all his available money—some ten"
"6061",36,"pounds altogether—into his pockets, and went out again into the"

"6063",36,""
"6064",36,""

"6066",36,""
"6067",36,"XV."
"6068",36,"WHAT HAD HAPPENED IN SURREY."
"6069",36,""
"6070",36,""
"6071",36,"It was while the curate had sat and talked so wildly to me under the"
"6072",36,"hedge in the flat meadows near Halliford, and while my brother was"
"6073",36,"watching the fugitives stream over Westminster Bridge, that the"
"6074",36,"Martians had resumed the offensive. So far as one can ascertain from"
"6075",36,"the conflicting accounts that have been put forth, the majority of them"
"6076",36,"remained busied with preparations in the Horsell pit until nine that"
"6077",36,"night, hurrying on some operation that disengaged huge volumes of green"
"6078",36,"smoke."
"6079",36,""
"6080",36,"But three certainly came out about eight o’clock and, advancing slowly"
"6081",36,"and cautiously, made their way through Byfleet and Pyrford towards"
"6082",36,"Ripley and Weybridge, and so came in sight of the expectant batteries"
"6083",36,"against the setting sun. These Martians did not advance in a body, but"
"6084",36,"in a line, each perhaps a mile and a half from his nearest fellow. They"
"6085",36,"communicated with one another by means of sirenlike howls, running up"
"6086",36,"and down the scale from one note to another."
"6087",36,""
"6088",36,"It was this howling and firing of the guns at Ripley and St. George’s"
"6089",36,"Hill that we had heard at Upper Halliford. The Ripley gunners,"
"6090",36,"unseasoned artillery volunteers who ought never to have been placed in"
"6091",36,"such a position, fired one wild, premature, ineffectual volley, and"
"6092",36,"bolted on horse and foot through the deserted village, while the"
"6093",36,"Martian, without using his Heat-Ray, walked serenely over their guns,"
"6094",36,"stepped gingerly among them, passed in front of them, and so came"
"6095",36,"unexpectedly upon the guns in Painshill Park, which he destroyed."
"6096",36,""
"6097",36,"The St. George’s Hill men, however, were better led or of a better"
"6098",36,"mettle. Hidden by a pine wood as they were, they seem to have been"
"6099",36,"quite unsuspected by the Martian nearest to them. They laid their guns"
"6100",36,"as deliberately as if they had been on parade, and fired at about a"
"6101",36,"thousand yards’ range."
"6102",36,""
"6103",36,"The shells flashed all round him, and he was seen to advance a few"
"6104",36,"paces, stagger, and go down. Everybody yelled together, and the guns"
"6105",36,"were reloaded in frantic haste. The overthrown Martian set up a"
"6106",36,"prolonged ululation, and immediately a second glittering giant,"
"6107",36,"answering him, appeared over the trees to the south. It would seem that"
"6108",36,"a leg of the tripod had been smashed by one of the shells. The whole of"
"6109",36,"the second volley flew wide of the Martian on the ground, and,"
"6110",36,"simultaneously, both his companions brought their Heat-Rays to bear on"
"6111",36,"the battery. The ammunition blew up, the pine trees all about the guns"
"6112",36,"flashed into fire, and only one or two of the men who were already"
"6113",36,"running over the crest of the hill escaped."
"6114",36,""
"6115",36,"After this it would seem that the three took counsel together and"
"6116",36,"halted, and the scouts who were watching them report that they remained"
"6117",36,"absolutely stationary for the next half hour. The Martian who had been"
"6118",36,"overthrown crawled tediously out of his hood, a small brown figure,"
"6119",36,"oddly suggestive from that distance of a speck of blight, and"
"6120",36,"apparently engaged in the repair of his support. About nine he had"
"6121",36,"finished, for his cowl was then seen above the trees again."
"6122",36,""
"6123",36,"It was a few minutes past nine that night when these three sentinels"
"6124",36,"were joined by four other Martians, each carrying a thick black tube. A"
"6125",36,"similar tube was handed to each of the three, and the seven proceeded"
"6126",36,"to distribute themselves at equal distances along a curved line between"
"6127",36,"St. George’s Hill, Weybridge, and the village of Send, southwest of"
"6128",36,"Ripley."
"6129",36,""
"6130",36,"A dozen rockets sprang out of the hills before them so soon as they"
"6131",36,"began to move, and warned the waiting batteries about Ditton and Esher."
"6132",36,"At the same time four of their fighting machines, similarly armed with"
"6133",36,"tubes, crossed the river, and two of them, black against the western"
"6134",36,"sky, came into sight of myself and the curate as we hurried wearily and"
"6135",36,"painfully along the road that runs northward out of Halliford. They"
"6136",36,"moved, as it seemed to us, upon a cloud, for a milky mist covered the"
"6137",36,"fields and rose to a third of their height."
"6138",36,""
"6139",36,"At this sight the curate cried faintly in his throat, and began"
"6140",36,"running; but I knew it was no good running from a Martian, and I turned"
"6141",36,"aside and crawled through dewy nettles and brambles into the broad"
"6142",36,"ditch by the side of the road. He looked back, saw what I was doing,"
"6143",36,"and turned to join me."
"6144",36,""
"6145",36,"The two halted, the nearer to us standing and facing Sunbury, the"
"6146",36,"remoter being a grey indistinctness towards the evening star, away"
"6147",36,"towards Staines."
"6148",36,""
"6149",36,"The occasional howling of the Martians had ceased; they took up their"
"6150",36,"positions in the huge crescent about their cylinders in absolute"
"6151",36,"silence. It was a crescent with twelve miles between its horns. Never"
"6152",36,"since the devising of gunpowder was the beginning of a battle so still."
"6153",36,"To us and to an observer about Ripley it would have had precisely the"
"6154",36,"same effect—the Martians seemed in solitary possession of the darkling"
"6155",36,"night, lit only as it was by the slender moon, the stars, the afterglow"
"6156",36,"of the daylight, and the ruddy glare from St. George’s Hill and the"
"6157",36,"woods of Painshill."
"6158",36,""
"6159",36,"But facing that crescent everywhere—at Staines, Hounslow, Ditton,"
"6160",36,"Esher, Ockham, behind hills and woods south of the river, and across"
"6161",36,"the flat grass meadows to the north of it, wherever a cluster of trees"
"6162",36,"or village houses gave sufficient cover—the guns were waiting. The"
"6163",36,"signal rockets burst and rained their sparks through the night and"
"6164",36,"vanished, and the spirit of all those watching batteries rose to a"
"6165",36,"tense expectation. The Martians had but to advance into the line of"
"6166",36,"fire, and instantly those motionless black forms of men, those guns"
"6167",36,"glittering so darkly in the early night, would explode into a"
"6168",36,"thunderous fury of battle."
"6169",36,""
"6170",36,"No doubt the thought that was uppermost in a thousand of those vigilant"
"6171",36,"minds, even as it was uppermost in mine, was the riddle—how much they"
"6172",36,"understood of us. Did they grasp that we in our millions were"
"6173",36,"organized, disciplined, working together? Or did they interpret our"
"6174",36,"spurts of fire, the sudden stinging of our shells, our steady"
"6175",36,"investment of their encampment, as we should the furious unanimity of"
"6176",36,"onslaught in a disturbed hive of bees? Did they dream they might"
"6177",36,"exterminate us? (At that time no one knew what food they needed.) A"
"6178",36,"hundred such questions struggled together in my mind as I watched that"
"6179",36,"vast sentinel shape. And in the back of my mind was the sense of all"
"6180",36,"the huge unknown and hidden forces Londonward. Had they prepared"
"6181",36,"pitfalls? Were the powder mills at Hounslow ready as a snare? Would the"
"6182",36,"Londoners have the heart and courage to make a greater Moscow of their"
"6183",36,"mighty province of houses?"
"6184",36,""
"6185",36,"Then, after an interminable time, as it seemed to us, crouching and"
"6186",36,"peering through the hedge, came a sound like the distant concussion of"
"6187",36,"a gun. Another nearer, and then another. And then the Martian beside us"
"6188",36,"raised his tube on high and discharged it, gunwise, with a heavy report"
"6189",36,"that made the ground heave. The one towards Staines answered him. There"
"6190",36,"was no flash, no smoke, simply that loaded detonation."
"6191",36,""
"6192",36,"I was so excited by these heavy minute-guns following one another that"
"6193",36,"I so far forgot my personal safety and my scalded hands as to clamber"
"6194",36,"up into the hedge and stare towards Sunbury. As I did so a second"
"6195",36,"report followed, and a big projectile hurtled overhead towards"
"6196",36,"Hounslow. I expected at least to see smoke or fire, or some such"
"6197",36,"evidence of its work. But all I saw was the deep blue sky above, with"
"6198",36,"one solitary star, and the white mist spreading wide and low beneath."
"6199",36,"And there had been no crash, no answering explosion. The silence was"
"6200",36,"restored; the minute lengthened to three."
"6201",36,""
"6202",36,"“What has happened?” said the curate, standing up beside me."
"6203",36,""
"6204",36,"“Heaven knows!” said I."
"6205",36,""
"6206",36,"A bat flickered by and vanished. A distant tumult of shouting began and"
"6207",36,"ceased. I looked again at the Martian, and saw he was now moving"
"6208",36,"eastward along the riverbank, with a swift, rolling motion."
"6209",36,""
"6210",36,"Every moment I expected the fire of some hidden battery to spring upon"
"6211",36,"him; but the evening calm was unbroken. The figure of the Martian grew"
"6212",36,"smaller as he receded, and presently the mist and the gathering night"
"6213",36,"had swallowed him up. By a common impulse we clambered higher. Towards"
"6214",36,"Sunbury was a dark appearance, as though a conical hill had suddenly"
"6215",36,"come into being there, hiding our view of the farther country; and"
"6216",36,"then, remoter across the river, over Walton, we saw another such"
"6217",36,"summit. These hill-like forms grew lower and broader even as we stared."
"6218",36,""
"6219",36,"Moved by a sudden thought, I looked northward, and there I perceived a"
"6220",36,"third of these cloudy black kopjes had risen."
"6221",36,""
"6222",36,"Everything had suddenly become very still. Far away to the southeast,"
"6223",36,"marking the quiet, we heard the Martians hooting to one another, and"
"6224",36,"then the air quivered again with the distant thud of their guns. But"
"6225",36,"the earthly artillery made no reply."
"6226",36,""
"6227",36,"Now at the time we could not understand these things, but later I was"
"6228",36,"to learn the meaning of these ominous kopjes that gathered in the"
"6229",36,"twilight. Each of the Martians, standing in the great crescent I have"
"6230",36,"described, had discharged, by means of the gunlike tube he carried, a"
"6231",36,"huge canister over whatever hill, copse, cluster of houses, or other"
"6232",36,"possible cover for guns, chanced to be in front of him. Some fired only"
"6233",36,"one of these, some two—as in the case of the one we had seen; the one"
"6234",36,"at Ripley is said to have discharged no fewer than five at that time."
"6235",36,"These canisters smashed on striking the ground—they did not explode—and"
"6236",36,"incontinently disengaged an enormous volume of heavy, inky vapour,"
"6237",36,"coiling and pouring upward in a huge and ebony cumulus cloud, a gaseous"
"6238",36,"hill that sank and spread itself slowly over the surrounding country."
"6239",36,"And the touch of that vapour, the inhaling of its pungent wisps, was"
"6240",36,"death to all that breathes."
"6241",36,""
"6242",36,"It was heavy, this vapour, heavier than the densest smoke, so that,"
"6243",36,"after the first tumultuous uprush and outflow of its impact, it sank"
"6244",36,"down through the air and poured over the ground in a manner rather"
"6245",36,"liquid than gaseous, abandoning the hills, and streaming into the"
"6246",36,"valleys and ditches and watercourses even as I have heard the"
"6247",36,"carbonic-acid gas that pours from volcanic clefts is wont to do. And"
"6248",36,"where it came upon water some chemical action occurred, and the surface"
"6249",36,"would be instantly covered with a powdery scum that sank slowly and"
"6250",36,"made way for more. The scum was absolutely insoluble, and it is a"
"6251",36,"strange thing, seeing the instant effect of the gas, that one could"
"6252",36,"drink without hurt the water from which it had been strained. The"
"6253",36,"vapour did not diffuse as a true gas would do. It hung together in"
"6254",36,"banks, flowing sluggishly down the slope of the land and driving"
"6255",36,"reluctantly before the wind, and very slowly it combined with the mist"
"6256",36,"and moisture of the air, and sank to the earth in the form of dust."
"6257",36,"Save that an unknown element giving a group of four lines in the blue"
"6258",36,"of the spectrum is concerned, we are still entirely ignorant of the"
"6259",36,"nature of this substance."
"6260",36,""
"6261",36,"Once the tumultuous upheaval of its dispersion was over, the black"
"6262",36,"smoke clung so closely to the ground, even before its precipitation,"
"6263",36,"that fifty feet up in the air, on the roofs and upper stories of high"
"6264",36,"houses and on great trees, there was a chance of escaping its poison"
"6265",36,"altogether, as was proved even that night at Street Cobham and Ditton."
"6266",36,""
"6267",36,"The man who escaped at the former place tells a wonderful story of the"
"6268",36,"strangeness of its coiling flow, and how he looked down from the church"
"6269",36,"spire and saw the houses of the village rising like ghosts out of its"
"6270",36,"inky nothingness. For a day and a half he remained there, weary,"
"6271",36,"starving and sun-scorched, the earth under the blue sky and against the"
"6272",36,"prospect of the distant hills a velvet-black expanse, with red roofs,"
"6273",36,"green trees, and, later, black-veiled shrubs and gates, barns,"
"6274",36,"outhouses, and walls, rising here and there into the sunlight."
"6275",36,""
"6276",36,"But that was at Street Cobham, where the black vapour was allowed to"
"6277",36,"remain until it sank of its own accord into the ground. As a rule the"
"6278",36,"Martians, when it had served its purpose, cleared the air of it again"
"6279",36,"by wading into it and directing a jet of steam upon it."
"6280",36,""
"6281",36,"This they did with the vapour banks near us, as we saw in the starlight"
"6282",36,"from the window of a deserted house at Upper Halliford, whither we had"
"6283",36,"returned. From there we could see the searchlights on Richmond Hill and"
"6284",36,"Kingston Hill going to and fro, and about eleven the windows rattled,"
"6285",36,"and we heard the sound of the huge siege guns that had been put in"
"6286",36,"position there. These continued intermittently for the space of a"
"6287",36,"quarter of an hour, sending chance shots at the invisible Martians at"
"6288",36,"Hampton and Ditton, and then the pale beams of the electric light"
"6289",36,"vanished, and were replaced by a bright red glow."
"6290",36,""
"6291",36,"Then the fourth cylinder fell—a brilliant green meteor—as I learned"
"6292",36,"afterwards, in Bushey Park. Before the guns on the Richmond and"
"6293",36,"Kingston line of hills began, there was a fitful cannonade far away in"
"6294",36,"the southwest, due, I believe, to guns being fired haphazard before the"
"6295",36,"black vapour could overwhelm the gunners."
"6296",36,""
"6297",36,"So, setting about it as methodically as men might smoke out a wasps’"
"6298",36,"nest, the Martians spread this strange stifling vapour over the"
"6299",36,"Londonward country. The horns of the crescent slowly moved apart, until"
"6300",36,"at last they formed a line from Hanwell to Coombe and Malden. All night"
"6301",36,"through their destructive tubes advanced. Never once, after the Martian"
"6302",36,"at St. George’s Hill was brought down, did they give the artillery the"
"6303",36,"ghost of a chance against them. Wherever there was a possibility of"
"6304",36,"guns being laid for them unseen, a fresh canister of the black vapour"
"6305",36,"was discharged, and where the guns were openly displayed the Heat-Ray"
"6306",36,"was brought to bear."
"6307",36,""
"6308",36,"By midnight the blazing trees along the slopes of Richmond Park and the"
"6309",36,"glare of Kingston Hill threw their light upon a network of black smoke,"
"6310",36,"blotting out the whole valley of the Thames and extending as far as the"
"6311",36,"eye could reach. And through this two Martians slowly waded, and turned"
"6312",36,"their hissing steam jets this way and that."
"6313",36,""
"6314",36,"They were sparing of the Heat-Ray that night, either because they had"
"6315",36,"but a limited supply of material for its production or because they did"
"6316",36,"not wish to destroy the country but only to crush and overawe the"
"6317",36,"opposition they had aroused. In the latter aim they certainly"
"6318",36,"succeeded. Sunday night was the end of the organised opposition to"
"6319",36,"their movements. After that no body of men would stand against them, so"
"6320",36,"hopeless was the enterprise. Even the crews of the torpedo-boats and"
"6321",36,"destroyers that had brought their quick-firers up the Thames refused to"
"6322",36,"stop, mutinied, and went down again. The only offensive operation men"
"6323",36,"ventured upon after that night was the preparation of mines and"
"6324",36,"pitfalls, and even in that their energies were frantic and spasmodic."
"6325",36,""
"6326",36,"One has to imagine, as well as one may, the fate of those batteries"
"6327",36,"towards Esher, waiting so tensely in the twilight. Survivors there were"
"6328",36,"none. One may picture the orderly expectation, the officers alert and"
"6329",36,"watchful, the gunners ready, the ammunition piled to hand, the limber"
"6330",36,"gunners with their horses and waggons, the groups of civilian"
"6331",36,"spectators standing as near as they were permitted, the evening"
"6332",36,"stillness, the ambulances and hospital tents with the burned and"
"6333",36,"wounded from Weybridge; then the dull resonance of the shots the"
"6334",36,"Martians fired, and the clumsy projectile whirling over the trees and"
"6335",36,"houses and smashing amid the neighbouring fields."
"6336",36,""
"6337",36,"One may picture, too, the sudden shifting of the attention, the swiftly"
"6338",36,"spreading coils and bellyings of that blackness advancing headlong,"
"6339",36,"towering heavenward, turning the twilight to a palpable darkness, a"
"6340",36,"strange and horrible antagonist of vapour striding upon its victims,"
"6341",36,"men and horses near it seen dimly, running, shrieking, falling"
"6342",36,"headlong, shouts of dismay, the guns suddenly abandoned, men choking"
"6343",36,"and writhing on the ground, and the swift broadening-out of the opaque"
"6344",36,"cone of smoke. And then night and extinction—nothing but a silent mass"
"6345",36,"of impenetrable vapour hiding its dead."
"6346",36,""
"6347",36,"Before dawn the black vapour was pouring through the streets of"
"6348",36,"Richmond, and the disintegrating organism of government was, with a"
"6349",36,"last expiring effort, rousing the population of London to the necessity"
"6350",36,"of flight."
"6351",36,""
"6352",36,""
"6353",36,""
"6354",36,""
"6355",36,"XVI."
"6356",36,"THE EXODUS FROM LONDON."
"6357",36,""
"6358",36,""
"6359",36,"So you understand the roaring wave of fear that swept through the"
"6360",36,"greatest city in the world just as Monday was dawning—the stream of"
"6361",36,"flight rising swiftly to a torrent, lashing in a foaming tumult round"
"6362",36,"the railway stations, banked up into a horrible struggle about the"
"6363",36,"shipping in the Thames, and hurrying by every available channel"
"6364",36,"northward and eastward. By ten o’clock the police organisation, and by"
"6365",36,"midday even the railway organisations, were losing coherency, losing"
"6366",36,"shape and efficiency, guttering, softening, running at last in that"
"6367",36,"swift liquefaction of the social body."
"6368",36,""
"6369",36,"All the railway lines north of the Thames and the South-Eastern people"
"6370",36,"at Cannon Street had been warned by midnight on Sunday, and trains were"
"6371",36,"being filled. People were fighting savagely for standing-room in the"
"6372",36,"carriages even at two o’clock. By three, people were being trampled and"
"6373",36,"crushed even in Bishopsgate Street, a couple of hundred yards or more"
"6374",36,"from Liverpool Street station; revolvers were fired, people stabbed,"
"6375",36,"and the policemen who had been sent to direct the traffic, exhausted"
"6376",36,"and infuriated, were breaking the heads of the people they were called"
"6377",36,"out to protect."
"6378",36,""
"6379",36,"And as the day advanced and the engine drivers and stokers refused to"
"6380",36,"return to London, the pressure of the flight drove the people in an"
"6381",36,"ever-thickening multitude away from the stations and along the"
"6382",36,"northward-running roads. By midday a Martian had been seen at Barnes,"
"6383",36,"and a cloud of slowly sinking black vapour drove along the Thames and"
"6384",36,"across the flats of Lambeth, cutting off all escape over the bridges in"
"6385",36,"its sluggish advance. Another bank drove over Ealing, and surrounded a"
"6386",36,"little island of survivors on Castle Hill, alive, but unable to escape."
"6387",36,""
"6388",36,"After a fruitless struggle to get aboard a North-Western train at Chalk"
"6389",36,"Farm—the engines of the trains that had loaded in the goods yard there"
"6390",36,"_ploughed_ through shrieking people, and a dozen stalwart men fought to"
"6391",36,"keep the crowd from crushing the driver against his furnace—my brother"
"6392",36,"emerged upon the Chalk Farm road, dodged across through a hurrying"
"6393",36,"swarm of vehicles, and had the luck to be foremost in the sack of a"
"6394",36,"cycle shop. The front tire of the machine he got was punctured in"
"6395",36,"dragging it through the window, but he got up and off, notwithstanding,"
"6396",36,"with no further injury than a cut wrist. The steep foot of Haverstock"
"6397",36,"Hill was impassable owing to several overturned horses, and my brother"
"6398",36,"struck into Belsize Road."
"6399",36,""
"6400",36,"So he got out of the fury of the panic, and, skirting the Edgware Road,"
"6401",36,"reached Edgware about seven, fasting and wearied, but well ahead of the"
"6402",36,"crowd. Along the road people were standing in the roadway, curious,"
"6403",36,"wondering. He was passed by a number of cyclists, some horsemen, and"
"6404",36,"two motor cars. A mile from Edgware the rim of the wheel broke, and the"
"6405",36,"machine became unridable. He left it by the roadside and trudged"
"6406",36,"through the village. There were shops half opened in the main street of"
"6407",36,"the place, and people crowded on the pavement and in the doorways and"
"6408",36,"windows, staring astonished at this extraordinary procession of"
"6409",36,"fugitives that was beginning. He succeeded in getting some food at an"
"6410",36,"inn."
"6411",36,""
"6412",36,"For a time he remained in Edgware not knowing what next to do. The"
"6413",36,"flying people increased in number. Many of them, like my brother,"
"6414",36,"seemed inclined to loiter in the place. There was no fresh news of the"
"6415",36,"invaders from Mars."
"6416",36,""
"6417",36,"At that time the road was crowded, but as yet far from congested. Most"
"6418",36,"of the fugitives at that hour were mounted on cycles, but there were"
"6419",36,"soon motor cars, hansom cabs, and carriages hurrying along, and the"
"6420",36,"dust hung in heavy clouds along the road to St. Albans."
"6421",36,""
"6422",36,"It was perhaps a vague idea of making his way to Chelmsford, where some"
"6423",36,"friends of his lived, that at last induced my brother to strike into a"
"6424",36,"quiet lane running eastward. Presently he came upon a stile, and,"
"6425",36,"crossing it, followed a footpath northeastward. He passed near several"
"6426",36,"farmhouses and some little places whose names he did not learn. He saw"
"6427",36,"few fugitives until, in a grass lane towards High Barnet, he happened"
"6428",36,"upon two ladies who became his fellow travellers. He came upon them"
"6429",36,"just in time to save them."
"6430",36,""
"6431",36,"He heard their screams, and, hurrying round the corner, saw a couple of"
"6432",36,"men struggling to drag them out of the little pony-chaise in which they"
"6433",36,"had been driving, while a third with difficulty held the frightened"
"6434",36,"pony’s head. One of the ladies, a short woman dressed in white, was"
"6435",36,"simply screaming; the other, a dark, slender figure, slashed at the man"
"6436",36,"who gripped her arm with a whip she held in her disengaged hand."
"6437",36,""
"6438",36,"My brother immediately grasped the situation, shouted, and hurried"
"6439",36,"towards the struggle. One of the men desisted and turned towards him,"
"6440",36,"and my brother, realising from his antagonist’s face that a fight was"
"6441",36,"unavoidable, and being an expert boxer, went into him forthwith and"
"6442",36,"sent him down against the wheel of the chaise."
"6443",36,""
"6444",36,"It was no time for pugilistic chivalry and my brother laid him quiet"
"6445",36,"with a kick, and gripped the collar of the man who pulled at the"
"6446",36,"slender lady’s arm. He heard the clatter of hoofs, the whip stung"
"6447",36,"across his face, a third antagonist struck him between the eyes, and"
"6448",36,"the man he held wrenched himself free and made off down the lane in the"
"6449",36,"direction from which he had come."
"6450",36,""
"6451",36,"Partly stunned, he found himself facing the man who had held the"
"6452",36,"horse’s head, and became aware of the chaise receding from him down the"
"6453",36,"lane, swaying from side to side, and with the women in it looking back."
"6454",36,"The man before him, a burly rough, tried to close, and he stopped him"
"6455",36,"with a blow in the face. Then, realising that he was deserted, he"
"6456",36,"dodged round and made off down the lane after the chaise, with the"
"6457",36,"sturdy man close behind him, and the fugitive, who had turned now,"
"6458",36,"following remotely."
"6459",36,""
"6460",36,"Suddenly he stumbled and fell; his immediate pursuer went headlong, and"
"6461",36,"he rose to his feet to find himself with a couple of antagonists again."
"6462",36,"He would have had little chance against them had not the slender lady"
"6463",36,"very pluckily pulled up and returned to his help. It seems she had had"
"6464",36,"a revolver all this time, but it had been under the seat when she and"
"6465",36,"her companion were attacked. She fired at six yards’ distance, narrowly"
"6466",36,"missing my brother. The less courageous of the robbers made off, and"
"6467",36,"his companion followed him, cursing his cowardice. They both stopped in"
"6468",36,"sight down the lane, where the third man lay insensible."
"6469",36,""
"6470",36,"“Take this!” said the slender lady, and she gave my brother her"
"6471",36,"revolver."
"6472",36,""
"6473",36,"“Go back to the chaise,” said my brother, wiping the blood from his"
"6474",36,"split lip."
"6475",36,""
"6476",36,"She turned without a word—they were both panting—and they went back to"
"6477",36,"where the lady in white struggled to hold back the frightened pony."
"6478",36,""
"6479",36,"The robbers had evidently had enough of it. When my brother looked"
"6480",36,"again they were retreating."
"6481",36,""
"6482",36,"“I’ll sit here,” said my brother, “if I may”; and he got upon the empty"
"6483",36,"front seat. The lady looked over her shoulder."
"6484",36,""
"6485",36,"“Give me the reins,” she said, and laid the whip along the pony’s side."
"6486",36,"In another moment a bend in the road hid the three men from my"
"6487",36,"brother’s eyes."
"6488",36,""
"6489",36,"So, quite unexpectedly, my brother found himself, panting, with a cut"
"6490",36,"mouth, a bruised jaw, and bloodstained knuckles, driving along an"
"6491",36,"unknown lane with these two women."
"6492",36,""
"6493",36,"He learned they were the wife and the younger sister of a surgeon"
"6494",36,"living at Stanmore, who had come in the small hours from a dangerous"
"6495",36,"case at Pinner, and heard at some railway station on his way of the"
"6496",36,"Martian advance. He had hurried home, roused the women—their servant"
"6497",36,"had left them two days before—packed some provisions, put his revolver"
"6498",36,"under the seat—luckily for my brother—and told them to drive on to"
"6499",36,"Edgware, with the idea of getting a train there. He stopped behind to"
"6500",36,"tell the neighbours. He would overtake them, he said, at about half"
"6501",36,"past four in the morning, and now it was nearly nine and they had seen"
"6502",36,"nothing of him. They could not stop in Edgware because of the growing"
"6503",36,"traffic through the place, and so they had come into this side lane."
"6504",36,""
"6505",36,"That was the story they told my brother in fragments when presently"
"6506",36,"they stopped again, nearer to New Barnet. He promised to stay with"
"6507",36,"them, at least until they could determine what to do, or until the"
"6508",36,"missing man arrived, and professed to be an expert shot with the"
"6509",36,"revolver—a weapon strange to him—in order to give them confidence."
"6510",36,""
"6511",36,"They made a sort of encampment by the wayside, and the pony became"
"6512",36,"happy in the hedge. He told them of his own escape out of London, and"
"6513",36,"all that he knew of these Martians and their ways. The sun crept higher"
"6514",36,"in the sky, and after a time their talk died out and gave place to an"
"6515",36,"uneasy state of anticipation. Several wayfarers came along the lane,"
"6516",36,"and of these my brother gathered such news as he could. Every broken"
"6517",36,"answer he had deepened his impression of the great disaster that had"
"6518",36,"come on humanity, deepened his persuasion of the immediate necessity"
"6519",36,"for prosecuting this flight. He urged the matter upon them."
"6520",36,""
"6521",36,"“We have money,” said the slender woman, and hesitated."
"6522",36,""
"6523",36,"Her eyes met my brother’s, and her hesitation ended."
"6524",36,""
"6525",36,"“So have I,” said my brother."
"6526",36,""
"6527",36,"She explained that they had as much as thirty pounds in gold, besides a"
"6528",36,"five-pound note, and suggested that with that they might get upon a"
"6529",36,"train at St. Albans or New Barnet. My brother thought that was"
"6530",36,"hopeless, seeing the fury of the Londoners to crowd upon the trains,"
"6531",36,"and broached his own idea of striking across Essex towards Harwich and"
"6532",36,"thence escaping from the country altogether."
"6533",36,""
"6534",36,"Mrs. Elphinstone—that was the name of the woman in white—would listen"
"6535",36,"to no reasoning, and kept calling upon “George”; but her sister-in-law"
"6536",36,"was astonishingly quiet and deliberate, and at last agreed to my"
"6537",36,"brother’s suggestion. So, designing to cross the Great North Road, they"
"6538",36,"went on towards Barnet, my brother leading the pony to save it as much"
"6539",36,"as possible. As the sun crept up the sky the day became excessively"
"6540",36,"hot, and under foot a thick, whitish sand grew burning and blinding, so"
"6541",36,"that they travelled only very slowly. The hedges were grey with dust."
"6542",36,"And as they advanced towards Barnet a tumultuous murmuring grew"
"6543",36,"stronger."
"6544",36,""
"6545",36,"They began to meet more people. For the most part these were staring"
"6546",36,"before them, murmuring indistinct questions, jaded, haggard, unclean."
"6547",36,"One man in evening dress passed them on foot, his eyes on the ground."
"6548",36,"They heard his voice, and, looking back at him, saw one hand clutched"
"6549",36,"in his hair and the other beating invisible things. His paroxysm of"
"6550",36,"rage over, he went on his way without once looking back."
"6551",36,""
"6552",36,"As my brother’s party went on towards the crossroads to the south of"
"6553",36,"Barnet they saw a woman approaching the road across some fields on"
"6554",36,"their left, carrying a child and with two other children; and then"
"6555",36,"passed a man in dirty black, with a thick stick in one hand and a small"
"6556",36,"portmanteau in the other. Then round the corner of the lane, from"

"6560",36,"East End factory girls, and a couple of little children crowded in the"
"6561",36,"cart."

"6831",36,""
"6832",36,"XVII."
"6833",36,"THE “THUNDER CHILD”."
"6834",36,""
"6835",36,""
"6836",36,"Had the Martians aimed only at destruction, they might on Monday have"
"6837",36,"annihilated the entire population of London, as it spread itself slowly"
"6838",36,"through the home counties. Not only along the road through Barnet, but"
"6839",36,"also through Edgware and Waltham Abbey, and along the roads eastward to"
"6840",36,"Southend and Shoeburyness, and south of the Thames to Deal and"
"6841",36,"Broadstairs, poured the same frantic rout. If one could have hung that"
"6842",36,"June morning in a balloon in the blazing blue above London every"
"6843",36,"northward and eastward road running out of the tangled maze of streets"
"6844",36,"would have seemed stippled black with the streaming fugitives, each dot"
"6845",36,"a human agony of terror and physical distress. I have set forth at"
"6846",36,"length in the last chapter my brother’s account of the road through"
"6847",36,"Chipping Barnet, in order that my readers may realise how that swarming"
"6848",36,"of black dots appeared to one of those concerned. Never before in the"
"6849",36,"history of the world had such a mass of human beings moved and suffered"
"6850",36,"together. The legendary hosts of Goths and Huns, the hugest armies Asia"
"6851",36,"has ever seen, would have been but a drop in that current. And this was"
"6852",36,"no disciplined march; it was a stampede—a stampede gigantic and"
"6853",36,"terrible—without order and without a goal, six million people unarmed"
"6854",36,"and unprovisioned, driving headlong. It was the beginning of the rout"
"6855",36,"of civilisation, of the massacre of mankind."
"6856",36,""
"6857",36,"Directly below him the balloonist would have seen the network of"
"6858",36,"streets far and wide, houses, churches, squares, crescents,"
"6859",36,"gardens—already derelict—spread out like a huge map, and in the"
"6860",36,"southward _blotted_. Over Ealing, Richmond, Wimbledon, it would have"
"6861",36,"seemed as if some monstrous pen had flung ink upon the chart. Steadily,"
"6862",36,"incessantly, each black splash grew and spread, shooting out"
"6863",36,"ramifications this way and that, now banking itself against rising"
"6864",36,"ground, now pouring swiftly over a crest into a new-found valley,"
"6865",36,"exactly as a gout of ink would spread itself upon blotting paper."
"6866",36,""
"6867",36,"And beyond, over the blue hills that rise southward of the river, the"
"6868",36,"glittering Martians went to and fro, calmly and methodically spreading"
"6869",36,"their poison cloud over this patch of country and then over that,"
"6870",36,"laying it again with their steam jets when it had served its purpose,"
"6871",36,"and taking possession of the conquered country. They do not seem to"
"6872",36,"have aimed at extermination so much as at complete demoralisation and"
"6873",36,"the destruction of any opposition. They exploded any stores of powder"
"6874",36,"they came upon, cut every telegraph, and wrecked the railways here and"
"6875",36,"there. They were hamstringing mankind. They seemed in no hurry to"
"6876",36,"extend the field of their operations, and did not come beyond the"
"6877",36,"central part of London all that day. It is possible that a very"
"6878",36,"considerable number of people in London stuck to their houses through"
"6879",36,"Monday morning. Certain it is that many died at home suffocated by the"
"6880",36,"Black Smoke."
"6881",36,""
"6882",36,"Until about midday the Pool of London was an astonishing scene."
"6883",36,"Steamboats and shipping of all sorts lay there, tempted by the enormous"
"6884",36,"sums of money offered by fugitives, and it is said that many who swam"
"6885",36,"out to these vessels were thrust off with boathooks and drowned. About"
"6886",36,"one o’clock in the afternoon the thinning remnant of a cloud of the"
"6887",36,"black vapour appeared between the arches of Blackfriars Bridge. At that"
"6888",36,"the Pool became a scene of mad confusion, fighting, and collision, and"
"6889",36,"for some time a multitude of boats and barges jammed in the northern"
"6890",36,"arch of the Tower Bridge, and the sailors and lightermen had to fight"
"6891",36,"savagely against the people who swarmed upon them from the riverfront."
"6892",36,"People were actually clambering down the piers of the bridge from"
"6893",36,"above."
"6894",36,""
"6895",36,"When, an hour later, a Martian appeared beyond the Clock Tower and"
"6896",36,"waded down the river, nothing but wreckage floated above Limehouse."
"6897",36,""
"6898",36,"Of the falling of the fifth cylinder I have presently to tell. The"
"6899",36,"sixth star fell at Wimbledon. My brother, keeping watch beside the"
"6900",36,"women in the chaise in a meadow, saw the green flash of it far beyond"
"6901",36,"the hills. On Tuesday the little party, still set upon getting across"
"6902",36,"the sea, made its way through the swarming country towards Colchester."
"6903",36,"The news that the Martians were now in possession of the whole of"
"6904",36,"London was confirmed. They had been seen at Highgate, and even, it was"
"6905",36,"said, at Neasden. But they did not come into my brother’s view until"
"6906",36,"the morrow."
"6907",36,""
"6908",36,"That day the scattered multitudes began to realise the urgent need of"
"6909",36,"provisions. As they grew hungry the rights of property ceased to be"
"6910",36,"regarded. Farmers were out to defend their cattle-sheds, granaries, and"
"6911",36,"ripening root crops with arms in their hands. A number of people now,"
"6912",36,"like my brother, had their faces eastward, and there were some"
"6913",36,"desperate souls even going back towards London to get food. These were"
"6914",36,"chiefly people from the northern suburbs, whose knowledge of the Black"
"6915",36,"Smoke came by hearsay. He heard that about half the members of the"
"6916",36,"government had gathered at Birmingham, and that enormous quantities of"
"6917",36,"high explosives were being prepared to be used in automatic mines"
"6918",36,"across the Midland counties."
"6919",36,""
"6920",36,"He was also told that the Midland Railway Company had replaced the"
"6921",36,"desertions of the first day’s panic, had resumed traffic, and was"
"6922",36,"running northward trains from St. Albans to relieve the congestion of"
"6923",36,"the home counties. There was also a placard in Chipping Ongar"
"6924",36,"announcing that large stores of flour were available in the northern"
"6925",36,"towns and that within twenty-four hours bread would be distributed"
"6926",36,"among the starving people in the neighbourhood. But this intelligence"
"6927",36,"did not deter him from the plan of escape he had formed, and the three"
"6928",36,"pressed eastward all day, and heard no more of the bread distribution"
"6929",36,"than this promise. Nor, as a matter of fact, did anyone else hear more"
"6930",36,"of it. That night fell the seventh star, falling upon Primrose Hill. It"
"6931",36,"fell while Miss Elphinstone was watching, for she took that duty"
"6932",36,"alternately with my brother. She saw it."
"6933",36,""
"6934",36,"On Wednesday the three fugitives—they had passed the night in a field"
"6935",36,"of unripe wheat—reached Chelmsford, and there a body of the"
"6936",36,"inhabitants, calling itself the Committee of Public Supply, seized the"
"6937",36,"pony as provisions, and would give nothing in exchange for it but the"
"6938",36,"promise of a share in it the next day. Here there were rumours of"
"6939",36,"Martians at Epping, and news of the destruction of Waltham Abbey Powder"
"6940",36,"Mills in a vain attempt to blow up one of the invaders."
"6941",36,""
"6942",36,"People were watching for Martians here from the church towers. My"
"6943",36,"brother, very luckily for him as it chanced, preferred to push on at"
"6944",36,"once to the coast rather than wait for food, although all three of them"
"6945",36,"were very hungry. By midday they passed through Tillingham, which,"
"6946",36,"strangely enough, seemed to be quite silent and deserted, save for a"
"6947",36,"few furtive plunderers hunting for food. Near Tillingham they suddenly"
"6948",36,"came in sight of the sea, and the most amazing crowd of shipping of all"
"6949",36,"sorts that it is possible to imagine."
"6950",36,""
"6951",36,"For after the sailors could no longer come up the Thames, they came on"
"6952",36,"to the Essex coast, to Harwich and Walton and Clacton, and afterwards"
"6953",36,"to Foulness and Shoebury, to bring off the people. They lay in a huge"
"6954",36,"sickle-shaped curve that vanished into mist at last towards the Naze."
"6955",36,"Close inshore was a multitude of fishing smacks—English, Scotch,"
"6956",36,"French, Dutch, and Swedish; steam launches from the Thames, yachts,"
"6957",36,"electric boats; and beyond were ships of larger burden, a multitude of"
"6958",36,"filthy colliers, trim merchantmen, cattle ships, passenger boats,"
"6959",36,"petroleum tanks, ocean tramps, an old white transport even, neat white"
"6960",36,"and grey liners from Southampton and Hamburg; and along the blue coast"
"6961",36,"across the Blackwater my brother could make out dimly a dense swarm of"
"6962",36,"boats chaffering with the people on the beach, a swarm which also"
"6963",36,"extended up the Blackwater almost to Maldon."
"6964",36,""
"6965",36,"About a couple of miles out lay an ironclad, very low in the water,"
"6966",36,"almost, to my brother’s perception, like a water-logged ship. This was"
"6967",36,"the ram _Thunder Child_. It was the only warship in sight, but far away"
"6968",36,"to the right over the smooth surface of the sea—for that day there was"
"6969",36,"a dead calm—lay a serpent of black smoke to mark the next ironclads of"
"6970",36,"the Channel Fleet, which hovered in an extended line, steam up and"
"6971",36,"ready for action, across the Thames estuary during the course of the"
"6972",36,"Martian conquest, vigilant and yet powerless to prevent it."
"6973",36,""
"6974",36,"At the sight of the sea, Mrs. Elphinstone, in spite of the assurances"
"6975",36,"of her sister-in-law, gave way to panic. She had never been out of"
"6976",36,"England before, she would rather die than trust herself friendless in a"
"6977",36,"foreign country, and so forth. She seemed, poor woman, to imagine that"
"6978",36,"the French and the Martians might prove very similar. She had been"
"6979",36,"growing increasingly hysterical, fearful, and depressed during the two"
"6980",36,"days’ journeyings. Her great idea was to return to Stanmore. Things had"
"6981",36,"been always well and safe at Stanmore. They would find George at"
"6982",36,"Stanmore...."
"6983",36,""
"6984",36,"It was with the greatest difficulty they could get her down to the"
"6985",36,"beach, where presently my brother succeeded in attracting the attention"
"6986",36,"of some men on a paddle steamer from the Thames. They sent a boat and"
"6987",36,"drove a bargain for thirty-six pounds for the three. The steamer was"
"6988",36,"going, these men said, to Ostend."
"6989",36,""
"6990",36,"It was about two o’clock when my brother, having paid their fares at"
"6991",36,"the gangway, found himself safely aboard the steamboat with his"
"6992",36,"charges. There was food aboard, albeit at exorbitant prices, and the"
"6993",36,"three of them contrived to eat a meal on one of the seats forward."
"6994",36,""
"6995",36,"There were already a couple of score of passengers aboard, some of whom"
"6996",36,"had expended their last money in securing a passage, but the captain"
"6997",36,"lay off the Blackwater until five in the afternoon, picking up"
"6998",36,"passengers until the seated decks were even dangerously crowded. He"
"6999",36,"would probably have remained longer had it not been for the sound of"
"7000",36,"guns that began about that hour in the south. As if in answer, the"
"7001",36,"ironclad seaward fired a small gun and hoisted a string of flags. A jet"
"7002",36,"of smoke sprang out of her funnels."
"7003",36,""
"7004",36,"Some of the passengers were of opinion that this firing came from"
"7005",36,"Shoeburyness, until it was noticed that it was growing louder. At the"
"7006",36,"same time, far away in the southeast the masts and upperworks of three"
"7007",36,"ironclads rose one after the other out of the sea, beneath clouds of"
"7008",36,"black smoke. But my brother’s attention speedily reverted to the"
"7009",36,"distant firing in the south. He fancied he saw a column of smoke rising"
"7010",36,"out of the distant grey haze."
"7011",36,""
"7012",36,"The little steamer was already flapping her way eastward of the big"
"7013",36,"crescent of shipping, and the low Essex coast was growing blue and"
"7014",36,"hazy, when a Martian appeared, small and faint in the remote distance,"
"7015",36,"advancing along the muddy coast from the direction of Foulness. At that"

"7017",36,"anger at his own delay, and the paddles seemed infected with his"
"7018",36,"terror. Every soul aboard stood at the bulwarks or on the seats of the"
"7019",36,"steamer and stared at that distant shape, higher than the trees or"
"7020",36,"church towers inland, and advancing with a leisurely parody of a human"
"7021",36,"stride."
"7022",36,""
"7023",36,"It was the first Martian my brother had seen, and he stood, more amazed"
"7024",36,"than terrified, watching this Titan advancing deliberately towards the"
"7025",36,"shipping, wading farther and farther into the water as the coast fell"
"7026",36,"away. Then, far away beyond the Crouch, came another, striding over"
"7027",36,"some stunted trees, and then yet another, still farther off, wading"
"7028",36,"deeply through a shiny mudflat that seemed to hang halfway up between"
"7029",36,"sea and sky. They were all stalking seaward, as if to intercept the"
"7030",36,"escape of the multitudinous vessels that were crowded between Foulness"
"7031",36,"and the Naze. In spite of the throbbing exertions of the engines of the"
"7032",36,"little paddle-boat, and the pouring foam that her wheels flung behind"
"7033",36,"her, she receded with terrifying slowness from this ominous advance."
"7034",36,""
"7035",36,"Glancing northwestward, my brother saw the large crescent of shipping"
"7036",36,"already writhing with the approaching terror; one ship passing behind"
"7037",36,"another, another coming round from broadside to end on, steamships"
"7038",36,"whistling and giving off volumes of steam, sails being let out,"
"7039",36,"launches rushing hither and thither. He was so fascinated by this and"

"7043",36,"the seat upon which he was standing. There was a shouting all about"
"7044",36,"him, a trampling of feet, and a cheer that seemed to be answered"
"7045",36,"faintly. The steamboat lurched and rolled him over upon his hands."
"7046",36,""
"7047",36,"He sprang to his feet and saw to starboard, and not a hundred yards"
"7048",36,"from their heeling, pitching boat, a vast iron bulk like the blade of a"

"7050",36,"waves of foam that leaped towards the steamer, flinging her paddles"
"7051",36,"helplessly in the air, and then sucking her deck down almost to the"
"7052",36,"waterline."
"7053",36,""
"7054",36,"A douche of spray blinded my brother for a moment. When his eyes were"
"7055",36,"clear again he saw the monster had passed and was rushing landward. Big"
"7056",36,"iron upperworks rose out of this headlong structure, and from that twin"

"7058",36,"torpedo ram, _Thunder Child_, steaming headlong, coming to the rescue"
"7059",36,"of the threatened shipping."
"7060",36,""
"7061",36,"Keeping his footing on the heaving deck by clutching the bulwarks, my"

"7072",36,"not know what to make of her. One shell, and they would have sent her"
"7073",36,"to the bottom forthwith with the Heat-Ray."
"7074",36,""
"7075",36,"She was steaming at such a pace that in a minute she seemed halfway"
"7076",36,"between the steamboat and the Martians—a diminishing black bulk against"
"7077",36,"the receding horizontal expanse of the Essex coast."
"7078",36,""
"7079",36,"Suddenly the foremost Martian lowered his tube and discharged a"

"7085",36,""

"7092",36,""
"7093",36,"A flicker of flame went up through the rising steam, and then the"

"7097",36,"other, and one shot splashed the water high close by the steamer,"
"7098",36,"ricocheted towards the other flying ships to the north, and smashed a"
"7099",36,"smack to matchwood."
"7100",36,""
"7101",36,"But no one heeded that very much. At the sight of the Martian’s"

"7106",36,"its ventilators and funnels spouting fire."
"7107",36,""
"7108",36,"She was alive still; the steering gear, it seems, was intact and her"
"7109",36,"engines working. She headed straight for a second Martian, and was"
"7110",36,"within a hundred yards of him when the Heat-Ray came to bear. Then with"

"7114",36,"impetus of its pace, had struck him and crumpled him up like a thing of"
"7115",36,"cardboard. My brother shouted involuntarily. A boiling tumult of steam"
"7116",36,"hid everything again."
"7117",36,""
"7118",36,"“Two!” yelled the captain."
"7119",36,""
"7120",36,"Everyone was shouting. The whole steamer from end to end rang with"
"7121",36,"frantic cheering that was taken up first by one and then by all in the"
"7122",36,"crowding multitude of ships and boats that was driving out to sea."
"7123",36,""
"7124",36,"The steam hung upon the water for many minutes, hiding the third"
"7125",36,"Martian and the coast altogether. And all this time the boat was"

"7129",36,"third Martian be seen. But the ironclads to seaward were now quite"

"7131",36,""
"7132",36,"The little vessel continued to beat its way seaward, and the ironclads"
"7133",36,"receded slowly towards the coast, which was hidden still by a marbled"

"7142",36,""
"7143",36,"Then suddenly out of the golden haze of the sunset came the vibration"

"7149",36,""
"7150",36,"The sun sank into grey clouds, the sky flushed and darkened, the"
"7151",36,"evening star trembled into sight. It was deep twilight when the captain"

"7163",36,"BOOK TWO"
"7164",36,"THE EARTH UNDER THE MARTIANS."
"7165",36,""
"7166",36,""
"7167",36,""
"7168",36,""
"7169",36,"I."
"7170",36,"UNDER FOOT."
"7171",36,""
"7172",36,""
"7173",36,"In the first book I have wandered so much from my own adventures to"
"7174",36,"tell of the experiences of my brother that all through the last two"
"7175",36,"chapters I and the curate have been lurking in the empty house at"
"7176",36,"Halliford whither we fled to escape the Black Smoke. There I will"
"7177",36,"resume. We stopped there all Sunday night and all the next day—the day"
"7178",36,"of the panic—in a little island of daylight, cut off by the Black Smoke"
"7179",36,"from the rest of the world. We could do nothing but wait in aching"
"7180",36,"inactivity during those two weary days."
"7181",36,""
"7182",36,"My mind was occupied by anxiety for my wife. I figured her at"
"7183",36,"Leatherhead, terrified, in danger, mourning me already as a dead man. I"
"7184",36,"paced the rooms and cried aloud when I thought of how I was cut off"
"7185",36,"from her, of all that might happen to her in my absence. My cousin I"
"7186",36,"knew was brave enough for any emergency, but he was not the sort of man"
"7187",36,"to realise danger quickly, to rise promptly. What was needed now was"
"7188",36,"not bravery, but circumspection. My only consolation was to believe"
"7189",36,"that the Martians were moving Londonward and away from her. Such vague"
"7190",36,"anxieties keep the mind sensitive and painful. I grew very weary and"
"7191",36,"irritable with the curate’s perpetual ejaculations; I tired of the"
"7192",36,"sight of his selfish despair. After some ineffectual remonstrance I"
"7193",36,"kept away from him, staying in a room—evidently a children’s"
"7194",36,"schoolroom—containing globes, forms, and copybooks. When he followed me"
"7195",36,"thither, I went to a box room at the top of the house and, in order to"
"7196",36,"be alone with my aching miseries, locked myself in."
"7197",36,""
"7198",36,"We were hopelessly hemmed in by the Black Smoke all that day and the"
"7199",36,"morning of the next. There were signs of people in the next house on"
"7200",36,"Sunday evening—a face at a window and moving lights, and later the"
"7201",36,"slamming of a door. But I do not know who these people were, nor what"
"7202",36,"became of them. We saw nothing of them next day. The Black Smoke"
"7203",36,"drifted slowly riverward all through Monday morning, creeping nearer"
"7204",36,"and nearer to us, driving at last along the roadway outside the house"
"7205",36,"that hid us."
"7206",36,""
"7207",36,"A Martian came across the fields about midday, laying the stuff with a"
"7208",36,"jet of superheated steam that hissed against the walls, smashed all the"
"7209",36,"windows it touched, and scalded the curate’s hand as he fled out of the"
"7210",36,"front room. When at last we crept across the sodden rooms and looked"
"7211",36,"out again, the country northward was as though a black snowstorm had"
"7212",36,"passed over it. Looking towards the river, we were astonished to see an"
"7213",36,"unaccountable redness mingling with the black of the scorched meadows."
"7214",36,""
"7215",36,"For a time we did not see how this change affected our position, save"
"7216",36,"that we were relieved of our fear of the Black Smoke. But later I"
"7217",36,"perceived that we were no longer hemmed in, that now we might get away."
"7218",36,"So soon as I realised that the way of escape was open, my dream of"
"7219",36,"action returned. But the curate was lethargic, unreasonable."
"7220",36,""
"7221",36,"“We are safe here,” he repeated; “safe here.”"
"7222",36,""
"7223",36,"I resolved to leave him—would that I had! Wiser now for the"
"7224",36,"artilleryman’s teaching, I sought out food and drink. I had found oil"
"7225",36,"and rags for my burns, and I also took a hat and a flannel shirt that I"
"7226",36,"found in one of the bedrooms. When it was clear to him that I meant to"
"7227",36,"go alone—had reconciled myself to going alone—he suddenly roused"
"7228",36,"himself to come. And all being quiet throughout the afternoon, we"
"7229",36,"started about five o’clock, as I should judge, along the blackened road"
"7230",36,"to Sunbury."
"7231",36,""
"7232",36,"In Sunbury, and at intervals along the road, were dead bodies lying in"
"7233",36,"contorted attitudes, horses as well as men, overturned carts and"
"7234",36,"luggage, all covered thickly with black dust. That pall of cindery"
"7235",36,"powder made me think of what I had read of the destruction of Pompeii."
"7236",36,"We got to Hampton Court without misadventure, our minds full of strange"
"7237",36,"and unfamiliar appearances, and at Hampton Court our eyes were relieved"
"7238",36,"to find a patch of green that had escaped the suffocating drift. We"
"7239",36,"went through Bushey Park, with its deer going to and fro under the"
"7240",36,"chestnuts, and some men and women hurrying in the distance towards"
"7241",36,"Hampton, and so we came to Twickenham. These were the first people we"
"7242",36,"saw."
"7243",36,""
"7244",36,"Away across the road the woods beyond Ham and Petersham were still"
"7245",36,"afire. Twickenham was uninjured by either Heat-Ray or Black Smoke, and"
"7246",36,"there were more people about here, though none could give us news. For"
"7247",36,"the most part they were like ourselves, taking advantage of a lull to"
"7248",36,"shift their quarters. I have an impression that many of the houses here"
"7249",36,"were still occupied by scared inhabitants, too frightened even for"
"7250",36,"flight. Here too the evidence of a hasty rout was abundant along the"
"7251",36,"road. I remember most vividly three smashed bicycles in a heap, pounded"
"7252",36,"into the road by the wheels of subsequent carts. We crossed Richmond"
"7253",36,"Bridge about half past eight. We hurried across the exposed bridge, of"
"7254",36,"course, but I noticed floating down the stream a number of red masses,"
"7255",36,"some many feet across. I did not know what these were—there was no time"
"7256",36,"for scrutiny—and I put a more horrible interpretation on them than they"
"7257",36,"deserved. Here again on the Surrey side were black dust that had once"
"7258",36,"been smoke, and dead bodies—a heap near the approach to the station;"
"7259",36,"but we had no glimpse of the Martians until we were some way towards"
"7260",36,"Barnes."
"7261",36,""
"7262",36,"We saw in the blackened distance a group of three people running down a"
"7263",36,"side street towards the river, but otherwise it seemed deserted. Up the"
"7264",36,"hill Richmond town was burning briskly; outside the town of Richmond"
"7265",36,"there was no trace of the Black Smoke."
"7266",36,""
"7267",36,"Then suddenly, as we approached Kew, came a number of people running,"
"7268",36,"and the upperworks of a Martian fighting-machine loomed in sight over"
"7269",36,"the housetops, not a hundred yards away from us. We stood aghast at our"
"7270",36,"danger, and had the Martian looked down we must immediately have"
"7271",36,"perished. We were so terrified that we dared not go on, but turned"
"7272",36,"aside and hid in a shed in a garden. There the curate crouched, weeping"
"7273",36,"silently, and refusing to stir again."
"7274",36,""
"7275",36,"But my fixed idea of reaching Leatherhead would not let me rest, and in"
"7276",36,"the twilight I ventured out again. I went through a shrubbery, and"
"7277",36,"along a passage beside a big house standing in its own grounds, and so"
"7278",36,"emerged upon the road towards Kew. The curate I left in the shed, but"
"7279",36,"he came hurrying after me."
"7280",36,""
"7281",36,"That second start was the most foolhardy thing I ever did. For it was"
"7282",36,"manifest the Martians were about us. No sooner had the curate overtaken"
"7283",36,"me than we saw either the fighting-machine we had seen before or"
"7284",36,"another, far away across the meadows in the direction of Kew Lodge."
"7285",36,"Four or five little black figures hurried before it across the"
"7286",36,"green-grey of the field, and in a moment it was evident this Martian"
"7287",36,"pursued them. In three strides he was among them, and they ran"
"7288",36,"radiating from his feet in all directions. He used no Heat-Ray to"
"7289",36,"destroy them, but picked them up one by one. Apparently he tossed them"
"7290",36,"into the great metallic carrier which projected behind him, much as a"
"7291",36,"workman’s basket hangs over his shoulder."
"7292",36,""
"7293",36,"It was the first time I realised that the Martians might have any other"
"7294",36,"purpose than destruction with defeated humanity. We stood for a moment"
"7295",36,"petrified, then turned and fled through a gate behind us into a walled"
"7296",36,"garden, fell into, rather than found, a fortunate ditch, and lay there,"
"7297",36,"scarce daring to whisper to each other until the stars were out."
"7298",36,""
"7299",36,"I suppose it was nearly eleven o’clock before we gathered courage to"
"7300",36,"start again, no longer venturing into the road, but sneaking along"
"7301",36,"hedgerows and through plantations, and watching keenly through the"
"7302",36,"darkness, he on the right and I on the left, for the Martians, who"
"7303",36,"seemed to be all about us. In one place we blundered upon a scorched"
"7304",36,"and blackened area, now cooling and ashen, and a number of scattered"
"7305",36,"dead bodies of men, burned horribly about the heads and trunks but with"
"7306",36,"their legs and boots mostly intact; and of dead horses, fifty feet,"
"7307",36,"perhaps, behind a line of four ripped guns and smashed gun carriages."
"7308",36,""
"7309",36,"Sheen, it seemed, had escaped destruction, but the place was silent and"
"7310",36,"deserted. Here we happened on no dead, though the night was too dark"
"7311",36,"for us to see into the side roads of the place. In Sheen my companion"
"7312",36,"suddenly complained of faintness and thirst, and we decided to try one"
"7313",36,"of the houses."
"7314",36,""
"7315",36,"The first house we entered, after a little difficulty with the window,"
"7316",36,"was a small semi-detached villa, and I found nothing eatable left in"
"7317",36,"the place but some mouldy cheese. There was, however, water to drink;"
"7318",36,"and I took a hatchet, which promised to be useful in our next"
"7319",36,"house-breaking."
"7320",36,""
"7321",36,"We then crossed to a place where the road turns towards Mortlake. Here"
"7322",36,"there stood a white house within a walled garden, and in the pantry of"
"7323",36,"this domicile we found a store of food—two loaves of bread in a pan, an"
"7324",36,"uncooked steak, and the half of a ham. I give this catalogue so"
"7325",36,"precisely because, as it happened, we were destined to subsist upon"
"7326",36,"this store for the next fortnight. Bottled beer stood under a shelf,"
"7327",36,"and there were two bags of haricot beans and some limp lettuces. This"
"7328",36,"pantry opened into a kind of wash-up kitchen, and in this was firewood;"
"7329",36,"there was also a cupboard, in which we found nearly a dozen of"
"7330",36,"burgundy, tinned soups and salmon, and two tins of biscuits."
"7331",36,""
"7332",36,"We sat in the adjacent kitchen in the dark—for we dared not strike a"
"7333",36,"light—and ate bread and ham, and drank beer out of the same bottle. The"
"7334",36,"curate, who was still timorous and restless, was now, oddly enough, for"
"7335",36,"pushing on, and I was urging him to keep up his strength by eating when"
"7336",36,"the thing happened that was to imprison us."
"7337",36,""
"7338",36,"“It can’t be midnight yet,” I said, and then came a blinding glare of"
"7339",36,"vivid green light. Everything in the kitchen leaped out, clearly"
"7340",36,"visible in green and black, and vanished again. And then followed such"
"7341",36,"a concussion as I have never heard before or since. So close on the"
"7342",36,"heels of this as to seem instantaneous came a thud behind me, a clash"
"7343",36,"of glass, a crash and rattle of falling masonry all about us, and the"
"7344",36,"plaster of the ceiling came down upon us, smashing into a multitude of"
"7345",36,"fragments upon our heads. I was knocked headlong across the floor"
"7346",36,"against the oven handle and stunned. I was insensible for a long time,"
"7347",36,"the curate told me, and when I came to we were in darkness again, and"
"7348",36,"he, with a face wet, as I found afterwards, with blood from a cut"
"7349",36,"forehead, was dabbing water over me."
"7350",36,""
