"12290",159,"XV."
"12291",159,"CONCERNING THE BEAST FOLK."
"12292",159,""
"12293",159,""
"12294",159,"I woke early. Moreau’s explanation stood before my mind, clear and"
"12295",159,"definite, from the moment of my awakening. I got out of the hammock and"
"12296",159,"went to the door to assure myself that the key was turned. Then I tried"
"12297",159,"the window-bar, and found it firmly fixed. That these man-like"
"12298",159,"creatures were in truth only bestial monsters, mere grotesque"
"12299",159,"travesties of men, filled me with a vague uncertainty of their"
"12300",159,"possibilities which was far worse than any definite fear."
"12301",159,""
"12302",159,"A tapping came at the door, and I heard the glutinous accents of M’ling"
"12303",159,"speaking. I pocketed one of the revolvers (keeping one hand upon it),"
"12304",159,"and opened to him."
"12305",159,""
"12306",159,"“Good-morning, sair,” he said, bringing in, in addition to the"
"12307",159,"customary herb-breakfast, an ill-cooked rabbit. Montgomery followed"
"12308",159,"him. His roving eye caught the position of my arm and he smiled askew."
"12309",159,""
"12310",159,"The puma was resting to heal that day; but Moreau, who was singularly"
"12311",159,"solitary in his habits, did not join us. I talked with Montgomery to"
"12312",159,"clear my ideas of the way in which the Beast Folk lived. In particular,"
"12313",159,"I was urgent to know how these inhuman monsters were kept from falling"
"12314",159,"upon Moreau and Montgomery and from rending one another. He explained"
"12315",159,"to me that the comparative safety of Moreau and himself was due to the"
"12316",159,"limited mental scope of these monsters. In spite of their increased"
"12317",159,"intelligence and the tendency of their animal instincts to reawaken,"
"12318",159,"they had certain fixed ideas implanted by Moreau in their minds, which"
"12319",159,"absolutely bounded their imaginations. They were really hypnotised; had"
"12320",159,"been told that certain things were impossible, and that certain things"
"12321",159,"were not to be done, and these prohibitions were woven into the texture"
"12322",159,"of their minds beyond any possibility of disobedience or dispute."
"12323",159,""
"12324",159,"Certain matters, however, in which old instinct was at war with"
"12325",159,"Moreau’s convenience, were in a less stable condition. A series of"
"12326",159,"propositions called the Law (I had already heard them recited) battled"
"12327",159,"in their minds with the deep-seated, ever-rebellious cravings of their"
"12328",159,"animal natures. This Law they were ever repeating, I found, and ever"
"12329",159,"breaking. Both Montgomery and Moreau displayed particular solicitude to"
"12330",159,"keep them ignorant of the taste of blood; they feared the inevitable"
"12331",159,"suggestions of that flavour. Montgomery told me that the Law,"
"12332",159,"especially among the feline Beast People, became oddly weakened about"
"12333",159,"nightfall; that then the animal was at its strongest; that a spirit of"
"12334",159,"adventure sprang up in them at the dusk, when they would dare things"
"12335",159,"they never seemed to dream about by day. To that I owed my stalking by"
"12336",159,"the Leopard-man, on the night of my arrival. But during these earlier"
"12337",159,"days of my stay they broke the Law only furtively and after dark; in"
"12338",159,"the daylight there was a general atmosphere of respect for its"
"12339",159,"multifarious prohibitions."
"12340",159,""
"12341",159,"And here perhaps I may give a few general facts about the island and"
"12342",159,"the Beast People. The island, which was of irregular outline and lay"
"12343",159,"low upon the wide sea, had a total area, I suppose, of seven or eight"
"12344",159,"square miles.[2] It was volcanic in origin, and was now fringed on"
"12345",159,"three sides by coral reefs; some fumaroles to the northward, and a hot"
"12346",159,"spring, were the only vestiges of the forces that had long since"
"12347",159,"originated it. Now and then a faint quiver of earthquake would be"
"12348",159,"sensible, and sometimes the ascent of the spire of smoke would be"
"12349",159,"rendered tumultuous by gusts of steam; but that was all. The population"
"12350",159,"of the island, Montgomery informed me, now numbered rather more than"
"12351",159,"sixty of these strange creations of Moreau’s art, not counting the"
"12352",159,"smaller monstrosities which lived in the undergrowth and were without"
"12353",159,"human form. Altogether he had made nearly a hundred and twenty; but"
"12354",159,"many had died, and others—like the writhing Footless Thing of which he"
"12355",159,"had told me—had come by violent ends. In answer to my question,"
"12356",159,"Montgomery said that they actually bore offspring, but that these"
"12357",159,"generally died. When they lived, Moreau took them and stamped the human"
"12358",159,"form upon them. There was no evidence of the inheritance of their"
"12359",159,"acquired human characteristics. The females were less numerous than the"
"12360",159,"males, and liable to much furtive persecution in spite of the monogamy"
"12361",159,"the Law enjoined."
"12362",159,""
"12363",159," [2]This description corresponds in every respect to Noble’s Isle.—C."
"12364",159," E. P."
"12365",159,""
"12366",159,""
"12367",159,"It would be impossible for me to describe these Beast People in detail;"
"12368",159,"my eye has had no training in details, and unhappily I cannot sketch."
"12369",159,"Most striking, perhaps, in their general appearance was the"
"12370",159,"disproportion between the legs of these creatures and the length of"
"12371",159,"their bodies; and yet—so relative is our idea of grace—my eye became"
"12372",159,"habituated to their forms, and at last I even fell in with their"
"12373",159,"persuasion that my own long thighs were ungainly. Another point was the"
"12374",159,"forward carriage of the head and the clumsy and inhuman curvature of"
"12375",159,"the spine. Even the Ape-man lacked that inward sinuous curve of the"
"12376",159,"back which makes the human figure so graceful. Most had their shoulders"
"12377",159,"hunched clumsily, and their short forearms hung weakly at their sides."
"12378",159,"Few of them were conspicuously hairy, at least until the end of my time"
"12379",159,"upon the island."
"12380",159,""
"12381",159,"The next most obvious deformity was in their faces, almost all of which"
"12382",159,"were prognathous, malformed about the ears, with large and protuberant"
"12383",159,"noses, very furry or very bristly hair, and often strangely-coloured or"
"12384",159,"strangely-placed eyes. None could laugh, though the Ape-man had a"
"12385",159,"chattering titter. Beyond these general characters their heads had"
"12386",159,"little in common; each preserved the quality of its particular species:"
"12387",159,"the human mark distorted but did not hide the leopard, the ox, or the"
"12388",159,"sow, or other animal or animals, from which the creature had been"
"12389",159,"moulded. The voices, too, varied exceedingly. The hands were always"
"12390",159,"malformed; and though some surprised me by their unexpected human"
"12391",159,"appearance, almost all were deficient in the number of the digits,"
"12392",159,"clumsy about the finger-nails, and lacking any tactile sensibility."
"12393",159,""
"12394",159,"The two most formidable Animal Men were my Leopard-man and a creature"
"12395",159,"made of hyena and swine. Larger than these were the three"
"12396",159,"bull-creatures who pulled in the boat. Then came the silvery-hairy-man,"
"12397",159,"who was also the Sayer of the Law, M’ling, and a satyr-like creature of"
"12398",159,"ape and goat. There were three Swine-men and a Swine-woman, a"
"12399",159,"mare-rhinoceros-creature, and several other females whose sources I did"
"12400",159,"not ascertain. There were several wolf-creatures, a bear-bull, and a"
"12401",159,"Saint-Bernard-man. I have already described the Ape-man, and there was"
"12402",159,"a particularly hateful (and evil-smelling) old woman made of vixen and"
"12403",159,"bear, whom I hated from the beginning. She was said to be a passionate"
"12404",159,"votary of the Law. Smaller creatures were certain dappled youths and my"
"12405",159,"little sloth-creature. But enough of this catalogue."
"12406",159,""
"12407",159,"At first I had a shivering horror of the brutes, felt all too keenly"
"12408",159,"that they were still brutes; but insensibly I became a little"
"12409",159,"habituated to the idea of them, and moreover I was affected by"
"12410",159,"Montgomery’s attitude towards them. He had been with them so long that"
"12411",159,"he had come to regard them as almost normal human beings. His London"
"12412",159,"days seemed a glorious, impossible past to him. Only once in a year or"
"12413",159,"so did he go to Arica to deal with Moreau’s agent, a trader in animals"
"12414",159,"there. He hardly met the finest type of mankind in that seafaring"
"12415",159,"village of Spanish mongrels. The men aboard-ship, he told me, seemed at"
"12416",159,"first just as strange to him as the Beast Men seemed to me,—unnaturally"
"12417",159,"long in the leg, flat in the face, prominent in the forehead,"
"12418",159,"suspicious, dangerous, and cold-hearted. In fact, he did not like men:"
"12419",159,"his heart had warmed to me, he thought, because he had saved my life. I"
"12420",159,"fancied even then that he had a sneaking kindness for some of these"
"12421",159,"metamorphosed brutes, a vicious sympathy with some of their ways, but"
"12422",159,"that he attempted to veil it from me at first."
"12423",159,""
"12424",159,"M’ling, the black-faced man, Montgomery’s attendant, the first of the"
"12425",159,"Beast Folk I had encountered, did not live with the others across the"
"12426",159,"island, but in a small kennel at the back of the enclosure. The"
"12427",159,"creature was scarcely so intelligent as the Ape-man, but far more"
"12428",159,"docile, and the most human-looking of all the Beast Folk; and"
"12429",159,"Montgomery had trained it to prepare food, and indeed to discharge all"
"12430",159,"the trivial domestic offices that were required. It was a complex"
"12431",159,"trophy of Moreau’s horrible skill,—a bear, tainted with dog and ox, and"
"12432",159,"one of the most elaborately made of all his creatures. It treated"
"12433",159,"Montgomery with a strange tenderness and devotion. Sometimes he would"
"12434",159,"notice it, pat it, call it half-mocking, half-jocular names, and so"
"12435",159,"make it caper with extraordinary delight; sometimes he would ill-treat"
"12436",159,"it, especially after he had been at the whiskey, kicking it, beating"
"12437",159,"it, pelting it with stones or lighted fusees. But whether he treated it"
"12438",159,"well or ill, it loved nothing so much as to be near him."
"12439",159,""
"12440",159,"I say I became habituated to the Beast People, that a thousand things"
"12441",159,"which had seemed unnatural and repulsive speedily became natural and"
"12442",159,"ordinary to me. I suppose everything in existence takes its colour from"
"12443",159,"the average hue of our surroundings. Montgomery and Moreau were too"
"12444",159,"peculiar and individual to keep my general impressions of humanity well"
"12445",159,"defined. I would see one of the clumsy bovine-creatures who worked the"
"12446",159,"launch treading heavily through the undergrowth, and find myself"
"12447",159,"asking, trying hard to recall, how he differed from some really human"
"12448",159,"yokel trudging home from his mechanical labours; or I would meet the"
"12449",159,"Fox-bear woman’s vulpine, shifty face, strangely human in its"
"12450",159,"speculative cunning, and even imagine I had met it before in some city"
"12451",159,"byway."
"12452",159,""
"12453",159,"Yet every now and then the beast would flash out upon me beyond doubt"
"12454",159,"or denial. An ugly-looking man, a hunch-backed human savage to all"
"12455",159,"appearance, squatting in the aperture of one of the dens, would stretch"
"12456",159,"his arms and yawn, showing with startling suddenness scissor-edged"
"12457",159,"incisors and sabre-like canines, keen and brilliant as knives. Or in"
"12458",159,"some narrow pathway, glancing with a transitory daring into the eyes of"
"12459",159,"some lithe, white-swathed female figure, I would suddenly see (with a"
"12460",159,"spasmodic revulsion) that she had slit-like pupils, or glancing down"
"12461",159,"note the curving nail with which she held her shapeless wrap about her."
"12462",159,"It is a curious thing, by the bye, for which I am quite unable to"
"12463",159,"account, that these weird creatures—the females, I mean—had in the"
"12464",159,"earlier days of my stay an instinctive sense of their own repulsive"
"12465",159,"clumsiness, and displayed in consequence a more than human regard for"
"12466",159,"the decency and decorum of extensive costume."
"12467",159,""
"12468",159,""
"12469",159,""
"12470",159,""
"12471",159,"XVI."
"12472",159,"HOW THE BEAST FOLK TASTE BLOOD."
"12473",159,""
"12474",159,""
"12475",159,"My inexperience as a writer betrays me, and I wander from the thread of"
"12476",159,"my story."
"12477",159,""
"12478",159,"After I had breakfasted with Montgomery, he took me across the island"
"12479",159,"to see the fumarole and the source of the hot spring into whose"
"12480",159,"scalding waters I had blundered on the previous day. Both of us carried"
"12481",159,"whips and loaded revolvers. While going through a leafy jungle on our"
"12482",159,"road thither, we heard a rabbit squealing. We stopped and listened, but"
"12483",159,"we heard no more; and presently we went on our way, and the incident"
"12484",159,"dropped out of our minds. Montgomery called my attention to certain"
"12485",159,"little pink animals with long hind-legs, that went leaping through the"
"12486",159,"undergrowth. He told me they were creatures made of the offspring of"
"12487",159,"the Beast People, that Moreau had invented. He had fancied they might"
"12488",159,"serve for meat, but a rabbit-like habit of devouring their young had"
"12489",159,"defeated this intention. I had already encountered some of these"
"12490",159,"creatures,—once during my moonlight flight from the Leopard-man, and"
"12491",159,"once during my pursuit by Moreau on the previous day. By chance, one"
"12492",159,"hopping to avoid us leapt into the hole caused by the uprooting of a"
"12493",159,"wind-blown tree; before it could extricate itself we managed to catch"
"12494",159,"it. It spat like a cat, scratched and kicked vigorously with its"
"12495",159,"hind-legs, and made an attempt to bite; but its teeth were too feeble"
"12496",159,"to inflict more than a painless pinch. It seemed to me rather a pretty"
"12497",159,"little creature; and as Montgomery stated that it never destroyed the"
"12498",159,"turf by burrowing, and was very cleanly in its habits, I should imagine"
"12499",159,"it might prove a convenient substitute for the common rabbit in"
"12500",159,"gentlemen’s parks."
"12501",159,""
"12502",159,"We also saw on our way the trunk of a tree barked in long strips and"
"12503",159,"splintered deeply. Montgomery called my attention to this. “Not to claw"
"12504",159,"bark of trees, _that_ is the Law,” he said. “Much some of them care for"
"12505",159,"it!” It was after this, I think, that we met the Satyr and the Ape-man."
"12506",159,"The Satyr was a gleam of classical memory on the part of Moreau,—his"
"12507",159,"face ovine in expression, like the coarser Hebrew type; his voice a"
"12508",159,"harsh bleat, his nether extremities Satanic. He was gnawing the husk of"
"12509",159,"a pod-like fruit as he passed us. Both of them saluted Montgomery."
"12510",159,""
"12511",159,"“Hail,” said they, “to the Other with the Whip!”"
"12512",159,""
"12513",159,"“There’s a Third with a Whip now,” said Montgomery. “So you’d better"
"12514",159,"mind!”"
"12515",159,""
"12516",159,"“Was he not made?” said the Ape-man. “He said—he said he was made.”"
"12517",159,""
"12518",159,"The Satyr-man looked curiously at me. “The Third with the Whip, he that"
"12519",159,"walks weeping into the sea, has a thin white face.”"
"12520",159,""
"12521",159,"“He has a thin long whip,” said Montgomery."
"12522",159,""
"12523",159,"“Yesterday he bled and wept,” said the Satyr. “You never bleed nor"
"12524",159,"weep. The Master does not bleed or weep.”"
"12525",159,""
"12526",159,"“Ollendorffian beggar!” said Montgomery, “you’ll bleed and weep if you"
"12527",159,"don’t look out!”"
"12528",159,""
"12529",159,"“He has five fingers, he is a five-man like me,” said the Ape-man."
"12530",159,""
"12531",159,"“Come along, Prendick,” said Montgomery, taking my arm; and I went on"
"12532",159,"with him."
"12533",159,""
"12534",159,"The Satyr and the Ape-man stood watching us and making other remarks to"
"12535",159,"each other."
"12536",159,""
"12537",159,"“He says nothing,” said the Satyr. “Men have voices.”"
"12538",159,""
"12539",159,"“Yesterday he asked me of things to eat,” said the Ape-man. “He did not"
"12540",159,"know.”"
"12541",159,""
"12542",159,"Then they spoke inaudible things, and I heard the Satyr laughing."
"12543",159,""
"12544",159,"It was on our way back that we came upon the dead rabbit. The red body"
"12545",159,"of the wretched little beast was rent to pieces, many of the ribs"
"12546",159,"stripped white, and the backbone indisputably gnawed."
"12547",159,""
"12548",159,"At that Montgomery stopped. “Good God!” said he, stooping down, and"
"12549",159,"picking up some of the crushed vertebrae to examine them more closely."
"12550",159,"“Good God!” he repeated, “what can this mean?”"
"12551",159,""
"12552",159,"“Some carnivore of yours has remembered its old habits,” I said after a"
"12553",159,"pause. “This backbone has been bitten through.”"
"12554",159,""
"12555",159,"He stood staring, with his face white and his lip pulled askew. “I"
"12556",159,"don’t like this,” he said slowly."
"12557",159,""
"12558",159,"“I saw something of the same kind,” said I, “the first day I came"
"12559",159,"here.”"
"12560",159,""
"12561",159,"“The devil you did! What was it?”"
"12562",159,""
"12563",159,"“A rabbit with its head twisted off.”"
"12564",159,""
"12565",159,"“The day you came here?”"
"12566",159,""
"12567",159,"“The day I came here. In the undergrowth at the back of the enclosure,"
"12568",159,"when I went out in the evening. The head was completely wrung off.”"
"12569",159,""
"12570",159,"He gave a long, low whistle."
"12571",159,""
"12572",159,"“And what is more, I have an idea which of your brutes did the thing."
"12573",159,"It’s only a suspicion, you know. Before I came on the rabbit I saw one"
"12574",159,"of your monsters drinking in the stream.”"
"12575",159,""
"12576",159,"“Sucking his drink?”"
"12577",159,""
"12578",159,"“Yes.”"
"12579",159,""
"12580",159,"“‘Not to suck your drink; that is the Law.’ Much the brutes care for"
"12581",159,"the Law, eh? when Moreau’s not about!”"
"12582",159,""
"12583",159,"“It was the brute who chased me.”"
"12584",159,""
"12585",159,"“Of course,” said Montgomery; “it’s just the way with carnivores. After"
"12586",159,"a kill, they drink. It’s the taste of blood, you know.—What was the"
"12587",159,"brute like?” he continued. “Would you know him again?” He glanced about"
"12588",159,"us, standing astride over the mess of dead rabbit, his eyes roving"
"12589",159,"among the shadows and screens of greenery, the lurking-places and"
"12590",159,"ambuscades of the forest that bounded us in. “The taste of blood,” he"
"12591",159,"said again."
"12592",159,""
"12593",159,"He took out his revolver, examined the cartridges in it and replaced"
"12594",159,"it. Then he began to pull at his dropping lip."
"12595",159,""
"12596",159,"“I think I should know the brute again,” I said. “I stunned him. He"
"12597",159,"ought to have a handsome bruise on the forehead of him.”"
"12598",159,""
"12599",159,"“But then we have to _prove_ that he killed the rabbit,” said"
"12600",159,"Montgomery. “I wish I’d never brought the things here.”"
"12601",159,""
"12602",159,"I should have gone on, but he stayed there thinking over the mangled"
"12603",159,"rabbit in a puzzle-headed way. As it was, I went to such a distance"
"12604",159,"that the rabbit’s remains were hidden."
"12605",159,""
"12606",159,"“Come on!” I said."
"12607",159,""
"12608",159,"Presently he woke up and came towards me. “You see,” he said, almost in"
"12609",159,"a whisper, “they are all supposed to have a fixed idea against eating"
"12610",159,"anything that runs on land. If some brute has by any accident tasted"
"12611",159,"blood—”"
"12612",159,""
"12613",159,"We went on some way in silence. “I wonder what can have happened,” he"
"12614",159,"said to himself. Then, after a pause again: “I did a foolish thing the"
"12615",159,"other day. That servant of mine—I showed him how to skin and cook a"
"12616",159,"rabbit. It’s odd—I saw him licking his hands—It never occurred to me.”"
"12617",159,""
"12618",159,"Then: “We must put a stop to this. I must tell Moreau.”"
"12619",159,""
"12620",159,"He could think of nothing else on our homeward journey."
"12621",159,""
"12622",159,"Moreau took the matter even more seriously than Montgomery, and I need"
"12623",159,"scarcely say that I was affected by their evident consternation."
"12624",159,""
"12625",159,"“We must make an example,” said Moreau. “I’ve no doubt in my own mind"
"12626",159,"that the Leopard-man was the sinner. But how can we prove it? I wish,"
"12627",159,"Montgomery, you had kept your taste for meat in hand, and gone without"
"12628",159,"these exciting novelties. We may find ourselves in a mess yet, through"
"12629",159,"it.”"
"12630",159,""
"12631",159,"“I was a silly ass,” said Montgomery. “But the thing’s done now; and"
"12632",159,"you said I might have them, you know.”"
"12633",159,""
"12634",159,"“We must see to the thing at once,” said Moreau. “I suppose if anything"
"12635",159,"should turn up, M’ling can take care of himself?”"
"12636",159,""
"12637",159,"“I’m not so sure of M’ling,” said Montgomery. “I think I ought to know"
"12638",159,"him.”"
"12639",159,""
"12640",159,"In the afternoon, Moreau, Montgomery, myself, and M’ling went across"
"12641",159,"the island to the huts in the ravine. We three were armed; M’ling"
"12642",159,"carried the little hatchet he used in chopping firewood, and some coils"
"12643",159,"of wire. Moreau had a huge cowherd’s horn slung over his shoulder."
"12644",159,""
"12645",159,"“You will see a gathering of the Beast People,” said Montgomery. “It is"
"12646",159,"a pretty sight!”"
"12647",159,""
"12648",159,"Moreau said not a word on the way, but the expression of his heavy,"
"12649",159,"white-fringed face was grimly set."
"12650",159,""
"12651",159,"We crossed the ravine down which smoked the stream of hot water, and"
"12652",159,"followed the winding pathway through the canebrakes until we reached a"
"12653",159,"wide area covered over with a thick, powdery yellow substance which I"
"12654",159,"believe was sulphur. Above the shoulder of a weedy bank the sea"
"12655",159,"glittered. We came to a kind of shallow natural amphitheatre, and here"
"12656",159,"the four of us halted. Then Moreau sounded the horn, and broke the"
"12657",159,"sleeping stillness of the tropical afternoon. He must have had strong"
"12658",159,"lungs. The hooting note rose and rose amidst its echoes, to at last an"
"12659",159,"ear-penetrating intensity."
"12660",159,""
"12661",159,"“Ah!” said Moreau, letting the curved instrument fall to his side"
"12662",159,"again."
"12663",159,""
"12664",159,"Immediately there was a crashing through the yellow canes, and a sound"
"12665",159,"of voices from the dense green jungle that marked the morass through"
"12666",159,"which I had run on the previous day. Then at three or four points on"
"12667",159,"the edge of the sulphurous area appeared the grotesque forms of the"
"12668",159,"Beast People hurrying towards us. I could not help a creeping horror,"
"12669",159,"as I perceived first one and then another trot out from the trees or"
"12670",159,"reeds and come shambling along over the hot dust. But Moreau and"
"12671",159,"Montgomery stood calmly enough; and, perforce, I stuck beside them."
"12672",159,""
"12673",159,"First to arrive was the Satyr, strangely unreal for all that he cast a"
"12674",159,"shadow and tossed the dust with his hoofs. After him from the brake"
"12675",159,"came a monstrous lout, a thing of horse and rhinoceros, chewing a straw"
"12676",159,"as it came; then appeared the Swine-woman and two Wolf-women; then the"
"12677",159,"Fox-bear witch, with her red eyes in her peaked red face, and then"
"12678",159,"others,—all hurrying eagerly. As they came forward they began to cringe"
"12679",159,"towards Moreau and chant, quite regardless of one another, fragments of"
"12680",159,"the latter half of the litany of the Law,—“His is the Hand that wounds;"
"12681",159,"His is the Hand that heals,” and so forth. As soon as they had"
"12682",159,"approached within a distance of perhaps thirty yards they halted, and"
"12683",159,"bowing on knees and elbows began flinging the white dust upon their"
"12684",159,"heads."
"12685",159,""
"12686",159,"Imagine the scene if you can! We three blue-clad men, with our"
"12687",159,"misshapen black-faced attendant, standing in a wide expanse of sunlit"
"12688",159,"yellow dust under the blazing blue sky, and surrounded by this circle"
"12689",159,"of crouching and gesticulating monstrosities,—some almost human save in"
"12690",159,"their subtle expression and gestures, some like cripples, some so"
"12691",159,"strangely distorted as to resemble nothing but the denizens of our"
"12692",159,"wildest dreams; and, beyond, the reedy lines of a canebrake in one"
"12693",159,"direction, a dense tangle of palm-trees on the other, separating us"
"12694",159,"from the ravine with the huts, and to the north the hazy horizon of the"
"12695",159,"Pacific Ocean."
"12696",159,""
"12697",159,"“Sixty-two, sixty-three,” counted Moreau. “There are four more.”"
"12698",159,""
"12699",159,"“I do not see the Leopard-man,” said I."
"12700",159,""
"12701",159,"Presently Moreau sounded the great horn again, and at the sound of it"
"12702",159,"all the Beast People writhed and grovelled in the dust. Then, slinking"
"12703",159,"out of the canebrake, stooping near the ground and trying to join the"
"12704",159,"dust-throwing circle behind Moreau’s back, came the Leopard-man. The"
"12705",159,"last of the Beast People to arrive was the little Ape-man. The earlier"
"12706",159,"animals, hot and weary with their grovelling, shot vicious glances at"
"12707",159,"him."
"12708",159,""
"12709",159,"“Cease!” said Moreau, in his firm, loud voice; and the Beast People sat"
"12710",159,"back upon their hams and rested from their worshipping."
"12711",159,""
"12712",159,"“Where is the Sayer of the Law?” said Moreau, and the hairy-grey"
"12713",159,"monster bowed his face in the dust."
"12714",159,""
"12715",159,"“Say the words!” said Moreau."
"12716",159,""
"12717",159,"Forthwith all in the kneeling assembly, swaying from side to side and"
"12718",159,"dashing up the sulphur with their hands,—first the right hand and a"
"12719",159,"puff of dust, and then the left,—began once more to chant their strange"
"12720",159,"litany. When they reached, “Not to eat Flesh or Fish, that is the Law,”"
"12721",159,"Moreau held up his lank white hand."
"12722",159,""
"12723",159,"“Stop!” he cried, and there fell absolute silence upon them all."
"12724",159,""
"12725",159,"I think they all knew and dreaded what was coming. I looked round at"
"12726",159,"their strange faces. When I saw their wincing attitudes and the furtive"
"12727",159,"dread in their bright eyes, I wondered that I had ever believed them to"
"12728",159,"be men."
"12729",159,""
"12730",159,"“That Law has been broken!” said Moreau."
"12731",159,""
"12732",159,"“None escape,” from the faceless creature with the silvery hair. “None"
"12733",159,"escape,” repeated the kneeling circle of Beast People."
"12734",159,""
"12735",159,"“Who is he?” cried Moreau, and looked round at their faces, cracking"
"12736",159,"his whip. I fancied the Hyena-swine looked dejected, so too did the"
"12737",159,"Leopard-man. Moreau stopped, facing this creature, who cringed towards"
"12738",159,"him with the memory and dread of infinite torment."
"12739",159,""
"12740",159,"“Who is he?” repeated Moreau, in a voice of thunder."
"12741",159,""
"12742",159,"“Evil is he who breaks the Law,” chanted the Sayer of the Law."
"12743",159,""
"12744",159,"Moreau looked into the eyes of the Leopard-man, and seemed to be"
"12745",159,"dragging the very soul out of the creature."
"12746",159,""
"12747",159,"“Who breaks the Law—” said Moreau, taking his eyes off his victim, and"
"12748",159,"turning towards us (it seemed to me there was a touch of exultation in"
"12749",159,"his voice)."
"12750",159,""
"12751",159,"“Goes back to the House of Pain,” they all clamoured,—“goes back to the"
"12752",159,"House of Pain, O Master!”"
"12753",159,""
"12754",159,"“Back to the House of Pain,—back to the House of Pain,” gabbled the"
"12755",159,"Ape-man, as though the idea was sweet to him."
"12756",159,""
"12757",159,"“Do you hear?” said Moreau, turning back to the criminal, “my"
"12758",159,"friend—Hullo!”"
"12759",159,""
"12760",159,"For the Leopard-man, released from Moreau’s eye, had risen straight"
"12761",159,"from his knees, and now, with eyes aflame and his huge feline tusks"
"12762",159,"flashing out from under his curling lips, leapt towards his tormentor."
"12763",159,"I am convinced that only the madness of unendurable fear could have"
"12764",159,"prompted this attack. The whole circle of threescore monsters seemed to"
"12765",159,"rise about us. I drew my revolver. The two figures collided. I saw"
"12766",159,"Moreau reeling back from the Leopard-man’s blow. There was a furious"
"12767",159,"yelling and howling all about us. Every one was moving rapidly. For a"
"12768",159,"moment I thought it was a general revolt. The furious face of the"
"12769",159,"Leopard-man flashed by mine, with M’ling close in pursuit. I saw the"
"12770",159,"yellow eyes of the Hyena-swine blazing with excitement, his attitude as"
"12771",159,"if he were half resolved to attack me. The Satyr, too, glared at me"
"12772",159,"over the Hyena-swine’s hunched shoulders. I heard the crack of Moreau’s"
"12773",159,"pistol, and saw the pink flash dart across the tumult. The whole crowd"
"12774",159,"seemed to swing round in the direction of the glint of fire, and I too"
"12775",159,"was swung round by the magnetism of the movement. In another second I"
"12776",159,"was running, one of a tumultuous shouting crowd, in pursuit of the"
"12777",159,"escaping Leopard-man."
"12778",159,""
"12779",159,"That is all I can tell definitely. I saw the Leopard-man strike Moreau,"
"12780",159,"and then everything spun about me until I was running headlong. M’ling"
"12781",159,"was ahead, close in pursuit of the fugitive. Behind, their tongues"
"12782",159,"already lolling out, ran the Wolf-women in great leaping strides. The"
"12783",159,"Swine folk followed, squealing with excitement, and the two Bull-men in"
"12784",159,"their swathings of white. Then came Moreau in a cluster of the Beast"
"12785",159,"People, his wide-brimmed straw hat blown off, his revolver in hand, and"
"12786",159,"his lank white hair streaming out. The Hyena-swine ran beside me,"
"12787",159,"keeping pace with me and glancing furtively at me out of his feline"
"12788",159,"eyes, and the others came pattering and shouting behind us."
"12789",159,""
"12790",159,"The Leopard-man went bursting his way through the long canes, which"
"12791",159,"sprang back as he passed, and rattled in M’ling’s face. We others in"
"12792",159,"the rear found a trampled path for us when we reached the brake. The"
"12793",159,"chase lay through the brake for perhaps a quarter of a mile, and then"
"12794",159,"plunged into a dense thicket, which retarded our movements exceedingly,"
"12795",159,"though we went through it in a crowd together,—fronds flicking into our"
"12796",159,"faces, ropy creepers catching us under the chin or gripping our ankles,"
"12797",159,"thorny plants hooking into and tearing cloth and flesh together."
"12798",159,""
"12799",159,"“He has gone on all-fours through this,” panted Moreau, now just ahead"
"12800",159,"of me."
"12801",159,""
"12802",159,"“None escape,” said the Wolf-bear, laughing into my face with the"
"12803",159,"exultation of hunting. We burst out again among rocks, and saw the"
"12804",159,"quarry ahead running lightly on all-fours and snarling at us over his"
"12805",159,"shoulder. At that the Wolf Folk howled with delight. The Thing was"
"12806",159,"still clothed, and at a distance its face still seemed human; but the"
"12807",159,"carriage of its four limbs was feline, and the furtive droop of its"
"12808",159,"shoulder was distinctly that of a hunted animal. It leapt over some"
"12809",159,"thorny yellow-flowering bushes, and was hidden. M’ling was halfway"
"12810",159,"across the space."
"12811",159,""
"12812",159,"Most of us now had lost the first speed of the chase, and had fallen"
"12813",159,"into a longer and steadier stride. I saw as we traversed the open that"
"12814",159,"the pursuit was now spreading from a column into a line. The"
"12815",159,"Hyena-swine still ran close to me, watching me as it ran, every now and"
"12816",159,"then puckering its muzzle with a snarling laugh. At the edge of the"
"12817",159,"rocks the Leopard-man, realising that he was making for the projecting"
"12818",159,"cape upon which he had stalked me on the night of my arrival, had"
"12819",159,"doubled in the undergrowth; but Montgomery had seen the manoeuvre, and"
"12820",159,"turned him again. So, panting, tumbling against rocks, torn by"
"12821",159,"brambles, impeded by ferns and reeds, I helped to pursue the"
"12822",159,"Leopard-man who had broken the Law, and the Hyena-swine ran, laughing"
"12823",159,"savagely, by my side. I staggered on, my head reeling and my heart"
"12824",159,"beating against my ribs, tired almost to death, and yet not daring to"
"12825",159,"lose sight of the chase lest I should be left alone with this horrible"
"12826",159,"companion. I staggered on in spite of infinite fatigue and the dense"
"12827",159,"heat of the tropical afternoon."
"12828",159,""
"12829",159,"At last the fury of the hunt slackened. We had pinned the wretched"
"12830",159,"brute into a corner of the island. Moreau, whip in hand, marshalled us"
"12831",159,"all into an irregular line, and we advanced now slowly, shouting to one"
"12832",159,"another as we advanced and tightening the cordon about our victim. He"
"12833",159,"lurked noiseless and invisible in the bushes through which I had run"
"12834",159,"from him during that midnight pursuit."
"12835",159,""
"12836",159,"“Steady!” cried Moreau, “steady!” as the ends of the line crept round"
"12837",159,"the tangle of undergrowth and hemmed the brute in."
"12838",159,""
"12839",159,"“Ware a rush!” came the voice of Montgomery from beyond the thicket."
"12840",159,""
"12841",159,"I was on the slope above the bushes; Montgomery and Moreau beat along"
"12842",159,"the beach beneath. Slowly we pushed in among the fretted network of"
"12843",159,"branches and leaves. The quarry was silent."
"12844",159,""
"12845",159,"“Back to the House of Pain, the House of Pain, the House of Pain!”"
"12846",159,"yelped the voice of the Ape-man, some twenty yards to the right."
"12847",159,""
"12848",159,"When I heard that, I forgave the poor wretch all the fear he had"
"12849",159,"inspired in me. I heard the twigs snap and the boughs swish aside"
"12850",159,"before the heavy tread of the Horse-rhinoceros upon my right. Then"
"12851",159,"suddenly through a polygon of green, in the half darkness under the"
"12852",159,"luxuriant growth, I saw the creature we were hunting. I halted. He was"
"12853",159,"crouched together into the smallest possible compass, his luminous"
"12854",159,"green eyes turned over his shoulder regarding me."
"12855",159,""
"12856",159,"It may seem a strange contradiction in me,—I cannot explain the"
"12857",159,"fact,—but now, seeing the creature there in a perfectly animal"
"12858",159,"attitude, with the light gleaming in its eyes and its imperfectly human"
"12859",159,"face distorted with terror, I realised again the fact of its humanity."
"12860",159,"In another moment other of its pursuers would see it, and it would be"
"12861",159,"overpowered and captured, to experience once more the horrible tortures"
"12862",159,"of the enclosure. Abruptly I slipped out my revolver, aimed between its"
"12863",159,"terror-struck eyes, and fired. As I did so, the Hyena-swine saw the"
"12864",159,"Thing, and flung itself upon it with an eager cry, thrusting thirsty"
"12865",159,"teeth into its neck. All about me the green masses of the thicket were"
"12866",159,"swaying and cracking as the Beast People came rushing together. One"
"12867",159,"face and then another appeared."
"12868",159,""
"12869",159,"“Don’t kill it, Prendick!” cried Moreau. “Don’t kill it!” and I saw him"
"12870",159,"stooping as he pushed through under the fronds of the big ferns."
"12871",159,""
"12872",159,"In another moment he had beaten off the Hyena-swine with the handle of"
"12873",159,"his whip, and he and Montgomery were keeping away the excited"
"12874",159,"carnivorous Beast People, and particularly M’ling, from the still"
"12875",159,"quivering body. The hairy-grey Thing came sniffing at the corpse under"
"12876",159,"my arm. The other animals, in their animal ardour, jostled me to get a"
"12877",159,"nearer view."
"12878",159,""
"12879",159,"“Confound you, Prendick!” said Moreau. “I wanted him.”"
"12880",159,""
"12881",159,"“I’m sorry,” said I, though I was not. “It was the impulse of the"
"12882",159,"moment.” I felt sick with exertion and excitement. Turning, I pushed my"
"12883",159,"way out of the crowding Beast People and went on alone up the slope"
"12884",159,"towards the higher part of the headland. Under the shouted directions"
"12885",159,"of Moreau I heard the three white-swathed Bull-men begin dragging the"
"12886",159,"victim down towards the water."
"12887",159,""
"12888",159,"It was easy now for me to be alone. The Beast People manifested a quite"
"12889",159,"human curiosity about the dead body, and followed it in a thick knot,"
"12890",159,"sniffing and growling at it as the Bull-men dragged it down the beach."
"12891",159,"I went to the headland and watched the bull-men, black against the"
"12892",159,"evening sky as they carried the weighted dead body out to sea; and like"
"12893",159,"a wave across my mind came the realisation of the unspeakable"
"12894",159,"aimlessness of things upon the island. Upon the beach among the rocks"
"12895",159,"beneath me were the Ape-man, the Hyena-swine, and several other of the"
"12896",159,"Beast People, standing about Montgomery and Moreau. They were all still"
"12897",159,"intensely excited, and all overflowing with noisy expressions of their"
"12898",159,"loyalty to the Law; yet I felt an absolute assurance in my own mind"
"12899",159,"that the Hyena-swine was implicated in the rabbit-killing. A strange"
"12900",159,"persuasion came upon me, that, save for the grossness of the line, the"
"12901",159,"grotesqueness of the forms, I had here before me the whole balance of"
"12902",159,"human life in miniature, the whole interplay of instinct, reason, and"
"12903",159,"fate in its simplest form. The Leopard-man had happened to go under:"
"12904",159,"that was all the difference. Poor brute!"
"12905",159,""
"12906",159,"Poor brutes! I began to see the viler aspect of Moreau’s cruelty. I had"
"12907",159,"not thought before of the pain and trouble that came to these poor"
"12908",159,"victims after they had passed from Moreau’s hands. I had shivered only"
"12909",159,"at the days of actual torment in the enclosure. But now that seemed to"
"12910",159,"me the lesser part. Before, they had been beasts, their instincts fitly"
"12911",159,"adapted to their surroundings, and happy as living things may be. Now"
"12912",159,"they stumbled in the shackles of humanity, lived in a fear that never"
"12913",159,"died, fretted by a law they could not understand; their mock-human"
"12914",159,"existence, begun in an agony, was one long internal struggle, one long"
"12915",159,"dread of Moreau—and for what? It was the wantonness of it that stirred"
"12916",159,"me."
"12917",159,""
"12918",159,"Had Moreau had any intelligible object, I could have sympathised at"
"12919",159,"least a little with him. I am not so squeamish about pain as that. I"
"12920",159,"could have forgiven him a little even, had his motive been only hate."
"12921",159,"But he was so irresponsible, so utterly careless! His curiosity, his"
"12922",159,"mad, aimless investigations, drove him on; and the Things were thrown"
"12923",159,"out to live a year or so, to struggle and blunder and suffer, and at"
"12924",159,"last to die painfully. They were wretched in themselves; the old animal"
"12925",159,"hate moved them to trouble one another; the Law held them back from a"
"12926",159,"brief hot struggle and a decisive end to their natural animosities."
"12927",159,""
"12928",159,"In those days my fear of the Beast People went the way of my personal"
"12929",159,"fear for Moreau. I fell indeed into a morbid state, deep and enduring,"
"12930",159,"and alien to fear, which has left permanent scars upon my mind. I must"
"12931",159,"confess that I lost faith in the sanity of the world when I saw it"
"12932",159,"suffering the painful disorder of this island. A blind Fate, a vast"
"12933",159,"pitiless mechanism, seemed to cut and shape the fabric of existence and"
"12934",159,"I, Moreau (by his passion for research), Montgomery (by his passion for"
"12935",159,"drink), the Beast People with their instincts and mental restrictions,"
"12936",159,"were torn and crushed, ruthlessly, inevitably, amid the infinite"
"12937",159,"complexity of its incessant wheels. But this condition did not come all"
"12938",159,"at once: I think indeed that I anticipate a little in speaking of it"
"12939",159,"now."
"12940",159,""
"12941",159,""
"12942",159,""
"12943",159,""
"12944",159,"XVII."
"12945",159,"A CATASTROPHE."
"12946",159,""
"12947",159,""
"12948",159,"Scarcely six weeks passed before I had lost every feeling but dislike"
"12949",159,"and abhorrence for this infamous experiment of Moreau’s. My one idea"
"12950",159,"was to get away from these horrible caricatures of my Maker’s image,"
"12951",159,"back to the sweet and wholesome intercourse of men. My"
"12952",159,"fellow-creatures, from whom I was thus separated, began to assume"
"12953",159,"idyllic virtue and beauty in my memory. My first friendship with"
"12954",159,"Montgomery did not increase. His long separation from humanity, his"
"12955",159,"secret vice of drunkenness, his evident sympathy with the Beast People,"
"12956",159,"tainted him to me. Several times I let him go alone among them. I"
"12957",159,"avoided intercourse with them in every possible way. I spent an"
"12958",159,"increasing proportion of my time upon the beach, looking for some"
"12959",159,"liberating sail that never appeared,—until one day there fell upon us"
"12960",159,"an appalling disaster, which put an altogether different aspect upon my"
"12961",159,"strange surroundings."
"12962",159,""
"12963",159,"It was about seven or eight weeks after my landing,—rather more, I"
"12964",159,"think, though I had not troubled to keep account of the time,—when this"
"12965",159,"catastrophe occurred. It happened in the early morning—I should think"
"12966",159,"about six. I had risen and breakfasted early, having been aroused by"
"12967",159,"the noise of three Beast Men carrying wood into the enclosure."
"12968",159,""
"12969",159,"After breakfast I went to the open gateway of the enclosure, and stood"
"12970",159,"there smoking a cigarette and enjoying the freshness of the early"
"12971",159,"morning. Moreau presently came round the corner of the enclosure and"
"12972",159,"greeted me. He passed by me, and I heard him behind me unlock and enter"
"12973",159,"his laboratory. So indurated was I at that time to the abomination of"
"12974",159,"the place, that I heard without a touch of emotion the puma victim"
"12975",159,"begin another day of torture. It met its persecutor with a shriek,"
"12976",159,"almost exactly like that of an angry virago."
"12977",159,""
"12978",159,"Then suddenly something happened,—I do not know what, to this day. I"
"12979",159,"heard a short, sharp cry behind me, a fall, and turning saw an awful"
"12980",159,"face rushing upon me,—not human, not animal, but hellish, brown, seamed"
"12981",159,"with red branching scars, red drops starting out upon it, and the"
"12982",159,"lidless eyes ablaze. I threw up my arm to defend myself from the blow"
"12983",159,"that flung me headlong with a broken forearm; and the great monster,"
"12984",159,"swathed in lint and with red-stained bandages fluttering about it,"
"12985",159,"leapt over me and passed. I rolled over and over down the beach, tried"
"12986",159,"to sit up, and collapsed upon my broken arm. Then Moreau appeared, his"
"12987",159,"massive white face all the more terrible for the blood that trickled"
"12988",159,"from his forehead. He carried a revolver in one hand. He scarcely"
"12989",159,"glanced at me, but rushed off at once in pursuit of the puma."
"12990",159,""
"12991",159,"I tried the other arm and sat up. The muffled figure in front ran in"
"12992",159,"great striding leaps along the beach, and Moreau followed her. She"
"12993",159,"turned her head and saw him, then doubling abruptly made for the"
"12994",159,"bushes. She gained upon him at every stride. I saw her plunge into"
"12995",159,"them, and Moreau, running slantingly to intercept her, fired and missed"
"12996",159,"as she disappeared. Then he too vanished in the green confusion. I"
"12997",159,"stared after them, and then the pain in my arm flamed up, and with a"
"12998",159,"groan I staggered to my feet. Montgomery appeared in the doorway,"
"12999",159,"dressed, and with his revolver in his hand."
"13000",159,""
"13001",159,"“Great God, Prendick!” he said, not noticing that I was hurt, “that"
"13002",159,"brute’s loose! Tore the fetter out of the wall! Have you seen them?”"
"13003",159,"Then sharply, seeing I gripped my arm, “What’s the matter?”"
"13004",159,""
"13005",159,"“I was standing in the doorway,” said I."
"13006",159,""
"13007",159,"He came forward and took my arm. “Blood on the sleeve,” said he, and"
"13008",159,"rolled back the flannel. He pocketed his weapon, felt my arm about"
"13009",159,"painfully, and led me inside. “Your arm is broken,” he said, and then,"
"13010",159,"“Tell me exactly how it happened—what happened?”"
"13011",159,""
"13012",159,"I told him what I had seen; told him in broken sentences, with gasps of"
"13013",159,"pain between them, and very dexterously and swiftly he bound my arm"
"13014",159,"meanwhile. He slung it from my shoulder, stood back and looked at me."
"13015",159,""
"13016",159,"“You’ll do,” he said. “And now?”"
"13017",159,""
"13018",159,"He thought. Then he went out and locked the gates of the enclosure. He"
"13019",159,"was absent some time."
"13020",159,""
"13021",159,"I was chiefly concerned about my arm. The incident seemed merely one"
"13022",159,"more of many horrible things. I sat down in the deck chair, and I must"
"13023",159,"admit swore heartily at the island. The first dull feeling of injury in"
"13024",159,"my arm had already given way to a burning pain when Montgomery"
"13025",159,"reappeared. His face was rather pale, and he showed more of his lower"
"13026",159,"gums than ever."
"13027",159,""
"13028",159,"“I can neither see nor hear anything of him,” he said. “I’ve been"
"13029",159,"thinking he may want my help.” He stared at me with his expressionless"
"13030",159,"eyes. “That was a strong brute,” he said. “It simply wrenched its"
"13031",159,"fetter out of the wall.” He went to the window, then to the door, and"
"13032",159,"there turned to me. “I shall go after him,” he said. “There’s another"
"13033",159,"revolver I can leave with you. To tell you the truth, I feel anxious"
"13034",159,"somehow.”"
"13035",159,""
"13036",159,"He obtained the weapon, and put it ready to my hand on the table; then"
"13037",159,"went out, leaving a restless contagion in the air. I did not sit long"
"13038",159,"after he left, but took the revolver in hand and went to the doorway."
"13039",159,""
"13040",159,"The morning was as still as death. Not a whisper of wind was stirring;"
"13041",159,"the sea was like polished glass, the sky empty, the beach desolate. In"
"13042",159,"my half-excited, half-feverish state, this stillness of things"
"13043",159,"oppressed me. I tried to whistle, and the tune died away. I swore"
"13044",159,"again,—the second time that morning. Then I went to the corner of the"
"13045",159,"enclosure and stared inland at the green bush that had swallowed up"
"13046",159,"Moreau and Montgomery. When would they return, and how? Then far away"
"13047",159,"up the beach a little grey Beast Man appeared, ran down to the water’s"
"13048",159,"edge and began splashing about. I strolled back to the doorway, then to"
"13049",159,"the corner again, and so began pacing to and fro like a sentinel upon"
"13050",159,"duty. Once I was arrested by the distant voice of Montgomery bawling,"
"13051",159,"“Coo-ee—Moreau!” My arm became less painful, but very hot. I got"
"13052",159,"feverish and thirsty. My shadow grew shorter. I watched the distant"
"13053",159,"figure until it went away again. Would Moreau and Montgomery never"
"13054",159,"return? Three sea-birds began fighting for some stranded treasure."
"13055",159,""
"13056",159,"Then from far away behind the enclosure I heard a pistol-shot. A long"
"13057",159,"silence, and then came another. Then a yelling cry nearer, and another"
"13058",159,"dismal gap of silence. My unfortunate imagination set to work to"
"13059",159,"torment me. Then suddenly a shot close by. I went to the corner,"
"13060",159,"startled, and saw Montgomery,—his face scarlet, his hair disordered,"
"13061",159,"and the knee of his trousers torn. His face expressed profound"
"13062",159,"consternation. Behind him slouched the Beast Man, M’ling, and round"
"13063",159,"M’ling’s jaws were some queer dark stains."
"13064",159,""
"13065",159,"“Has he come?” said Montgomery."
"13066",159,""
"13067",159,"“Moreau?” said I. “No.”"
"13068",159,""
"13069",159,"“My God!” The man was panting, almost sobbing. “Go back in,” he said,"
"13070",159,"taking my arm. “They’re mad. They’re all rushing about mad. What can"
"13071",159,"have happened? I don’t know. I’ll tell you, when my breath comes."
"13072",159,"Where’s some brandy?”"
"13073",159,""
"13074",159,"Montgomery limped before me into the room and sat down in the deck"
"13075",159,"chair. M’ling flung himself down just outside the doorway and began"
"13076",159,"panting like a dog. I got Montgomery some brandy-and-water. He sat"
"13077",159,"staring in front of him at nothing, recovering his breath. After some"
"13078",159,"minutes he began to tell me what had happened."
"13079",159,""
"13080",159,"He had followed their track for some way. It was plain enough at first"
"13081",159,"on account of the crushed and broken bushes, white rags torn from the"
"13082",159,"puma’s bandages, and occasional smears of blood on the leaves of the"
"13083",159,"shrubs and undergrowth. He lost the track, however, on the stony ground"
"13084",159,"beyond the stream where I had seen the Beast Man drinking, and went"
"13085",159,"wandering aimlessly westward shouting Moreau’s name. Then M’ling had"
"13086",159,"come to him carrying a light hatchet. M’ling had seen nothing of the"
"13087",159,"puma affair; had been felling wood, and heard him calling. They went on"
"13088",159,"shouting together. Two Beast Men came crouching and peering at them"
"13089",159,"through the undergrowth, with gestures and a furtive carriage that"
"13090",159,"alarmed Montgomery by their strangeness. He hailed them, and they fled"
"13091",159,"guiltily. He stopped shouting after that, and after wandering some time"
"13092",159,"farther in an undecided way, determined to visit the huts."
"13093",159,""
"13094",159,"He found the ravine deserted."
"13095",159,""
"13096",159,"Growing more alarmed every minute, he began to retrace his steps. Then"
"13097",159,"it was he encountered the two Swine-men I had seen dancing on the night"
"13098",159,"of my arrival; blood-stained they were about the mouth, and intensely"
"13099",159,"excited. They came crashing through the ferns, and stopped with fierce"
"13100",159,"faces when they saw him. He cracked his whip in some trepidation, and"
"13101",159,"forthwith they rushed at him. Never before had a Beast Man dared to do"
"13102",159,"that. One he shot through the head; M’ling flung himself upon the"
"13103",159,"other, and the two rolled grappling. M’ling got his brute under and"
"13104",159,"with his teeth in its throat, and Montgomery shot that too as it"
"13105",159,"struggled in M’ling’s grip. He had some difficulty in inducing M’ling"
"13106",159,"to come on with him. Thence they had hurried back to me. On the way,"
"13107",159,"M’ling had suddenly rushed into a thicket and driven out an under-sized"
"13108",159,"Ocelot-man, also blood-stained, and lame through a wound in the foot."
"13109",159,"This brute had run a little way and then turned savagely at bay, and"
"13110",159,"Montgomery—with a certain wantonness, I thought—had shot him."
"13111",159,""
"13112",159,"“What does it all mean?” said I."
"13113",159,""
"13114",159,"He shook his head, and turned once more to the brandy."
"13115",159,""
"13116",159,""
"13117",159,""
"13118",159,""
"13119",159,"XVIII."
"13120",159,"THE FINDING OF MOREAU."
"13121",159,""
"13122",159,""
"13123",159,"When I saw Montgomery swallow a third dose of brandy, I took it upon"
"13124",159,"myself to interfere. He was already more than half fuddled. I told him"
"13125",159,"that some serious thing must have happened to Moreau by this time, or"
"13126",159,"he would have returned before this, and that it behoved us to ascertain"
"13127",159,"what that catastrophe was. Montgomery raised some feeble objections,"
"13128",159,"and at last agreed. We had some food, and then all three of us started."
"13129",159,""
"13130",159,"It is possibly due to the tension of my mind, at the time, but even now"
"13131",159,"that start into the hot stillness of the tropical afternoon is a"
"13132",159,"singularly vivid impression. M’ling went first, his shoulder hunched,"
"13133",159,"his strange black head moving with quick starts as he peered first on"
"13134",159,"this side of the way and then on that. He was unarmed; his axe he had"
"13135",159,"dropped when he encountered the Swine-man. Teeth were _his_ weapons,"
"13136",159,"when it came to fighting. Montgomery followed with stumbling footsteps,"
"13137",159,"his hands in his pockets, his face downcast; he was in a state of"
"13138",159,"muddled sullenness with me on account of the brandy. My left arm was in"
"13139",159,"a sling (it was lucky it was my left), and I carried my revolver in my"
"13140",159,"right. Soon we traced a narrow path through the wild luxuriance of the"
"13141",159,"island, going northwestward; and presently M’ling stopped, and became"
"13142",159,"rigid with watchfulness. Montgomery almost staggered into him, and then"
"13143",159,"stopped too. Then, listening intently, we heard coming through the"
"13144",159,"trees the sound of voices and footsteps approaching us."
"13145",159,""
"13146",159,"“He is dead,” said a deep, vibrating voice."
"13147",159,""
"13148",159,"“He is not dead; he is not dead,” jabbered another."
"13149",159,""
"13150",159,"“We saw, we saw,” said several voices."
"13151",159,""
"13152",159,"“_Hul_-lo!” suddenly shouted Montgomery, “Hullo, there!”"
"13153",159,""
"13154",159,"“Confound you!” said I, and gripped my pistol."
"13155",159,""
"13156",159,"There was a silence, then a crashing among the interlacing vegetation,"
"13157",159,"first here, then there, and then half-a-dozen faces appeared,—strange"
"13158",159,"faces, lit by a strange light. M’ling made a growling noise in his"
"13159",159,"throat. I recognised the Ape-man: I had indeed already identified his"
"13160",159,"voice, and two of the white-swathed brown-featured creatures I had seen"
"13161",159,"in Montgomery’s boat. With these were the two dappled brutes and that"
"13162",159,"grey, horribly crooked creature who said the Law, with grey hair"
"13163",159,"streaming down its cheeks, heavy grey eyebrows, and grey locks pouring"
"13164",159,"off from a central parting upon its sloping forehead,—a heavy, faceless"
"13165",159,"thing, with strange red eyes, looking at us curiously from amidst the"
"13166",159,"green."
"13167",159,""
"13168",159,"For a space no one spoke. Then Montgomery hiccoughed, “Who—said he was"
"13169",159,"dead?”"
"13170",159,""
"13171",159,"The Monkey-man looked guiltily at the hairy-grey Thing. “He is dead,”"
"13172",159,"said this monster. “They saw.”"
"13173",159,""
"13174",159,"There was nothing threatening about this detachment, at any rate. They"
"13175",159,"seemed awestricken and puzzled."
"13176",159,""
"13177",159,"“Where is he?” said Montgomery."
"13178",159,""
"13179",159,"“Beyond,” and the grey creature pointed."
"13180",159,""
"13181",159,"“Is there a Law now?” asked the Monkey-man. “Is it still to be this and"
"13182",159,"that? Is he dead indeed?”"
"13183",159,""
"13184",159,"“Is there a Law?” repeated the man in white. “Is there a Law, thou"
"13185",159,"Other with the Whip?”"
"13186",159,""
"13187",159,"“He is dead,” said the hairy-grey Thing. And they all stood watching"
"13188",159,"us."
"13189",159,""
"13190",159,"“Prendick,” said Montgomery, turning his dull eyes to me. “He’s dead,"
"13191",159,"evidently.”"
"13192",159,""
"13193",159,"I had been standing behind him during this colloquy. I began to see how"
"13194",159,"things lay with them. I suddenly stepped in front of Montgomery and"
"13195",159,"lifted up my voice:—“Children of the Law,” I said, “he is _not_ dead!”"
"13196",159,"M’ling turned his sharp eyes on me. “He has changed his shape; he has"
"13197",159,"changed his body,” I went on. “For a time you will not see him. He"
"13198",159,"is—there,” I pointed upward, “where he can watch you. You cannot see"
"13199",159,"him, but he can see you. Fear the Law!”"
"13200",159,""
"13201",159,"I looked at them squarely. They flinched."
"13202",159,""
"13203",159,"“He is great, he is good,” said the Ape-man, peering fearfully upward"
"13204",159,"among the dense trees."
"13205",159,""
"13206",159,"“And the other Thing?” I demanded."
"13207",159,""
"13208",159,"“The Thing that bled, and ran screaming and sobbing,—that is dead too,”"
"13209",159,"said the grey Thing, still regarding me."
"13210",159,""
"13211",159,"“That’s well,” grunted Montgomery."
"13212",159,""
"13213",159,"“The Other with the Whip—” began the grey Thing."
"13214",159,""
"13215",159,"“Well?” said I."
"13216",159,""
"13217",159,"“Said he was dead.”"
"13218",159,""
"13219",159,"But Montgomery was still sober enough to understand my motive in"
"13220",159,"denying Moreau’s death. “He is not dead,” he said slowly, “not dead at"
"13221",159,"all. No more dead than I am.”"
"13222",159,""
"13223",159,"“Some,” said I, “have broken the Law: they will die. Some have died."
"13224",159,"Show us now where his old body lies,—the body he cast away because he"
"13225",159,"had no more need of it.”"
"13226",159,""
"13227",159,"“It is this way, Man who walked in the Sea,” said the grey Thing."
"13228",159,""
"13229",159,"And with these six creatures guiding us, we went through the tumult of"
"13230",159,"ferns and creepers and tree-stems towards the northwest. Then came a"
"13231",159,"yelling, a crashing among the branches, and a little pink homunculus"
"13232",159,"rushed by us shrieking. Immediately after appeared a monster in"
"13233",159,"headlong pursuit, blood-bedabbled, who was amongst us almost before he"
"13234",159,"could stop his career. The grey Thing leapt aside. M’ling, with a"
"13235",159,"snarl, flew at it, and was struck aside. Montgomery fired and missed,"
"13236",159,"bowed his head, threw up his arm, and turned to run. I fired, and the"
"13237",159,"Thing still came on; fired again, point-blank, into its ugly face. I"
"13238",159,"saw its features vanish in a flash: its face was driven in. Yet it"
"13239",159,"passed me, gripped Montgomery, and holding him, fell headlong beside"
"13240",159,"him and pulled him sprawling upon itself in its death-agony."
"13241",159,""
"13242",159,"I found myself alone with M’ling, the dead brute, and the prostrate"
"13243",159,"man. Montgomery raised himself slowly and stared in a muddled way at"
"13244",159,"the shattered Beast Man beside him. It more than half sobered him. He"
"13245",159,"scrambled to his feet. Then I saw the grey Thing returning cautiously"
"13246",159,"through the trees."
"13247",159,""
"13248",159,"“See,” said I, pointing to the dead brute, “is the Law not alive? This"
"13249",159,"came of breaking the Law.”"
"13250",159,""
"13251",159,"He peered at the body. “He sends the Fire that kills,” said he, in his"
"13252",159,"deep voice, repeating part of the Ritual. The others gathered round and"
"13253",159,"stared for a space."
"13254",159,""
"13255",159,"At last we drew near the westward extremity of the island. We came upon"
"13256",159,"the gnawed and mutilated body of the puma, its shoulder-bone smashed by"
"13257",159,"a bullet, and perhaps twenty yards farther found at last what we"
"13258",159,"sought. Moreau lay face downward in a trampled space in a canebrake."
"13259",159,"One hand was almost severed at the wrist and his silvery hair was"
"13260",159,"dabbled in blood. His head had been battered in by the fetters of the"
"13261",159,"puma. The broken canes beneath him were smeared with blood. His"
"13262",159,"revolver we could not find. Montgomery turned him over. Resting at"
"13263",159,"intervals, and with the help of the seven Beast People (for he was a"
"13264",159,"heavy man), we carried Moreau back to the enclosure. The night was"
"13265",159,"darkling. Twice we heard unseen creatures howling and shrieking past"
"13266",159,"our little band, and once the little pink sloth-creature appeared and"
"13267",159,"stared at us, and vanished again. But we were not attacked again. At"
"13268",159,"the gates of the enclosure our company of Beast People left us, M’ling"
"13269",159,"going with the rest. We locked ourselves in, and then took Moreau’s"
"13270",159,"mangled body into the yard and laid it upon a pile of brushwood. Then"
"13271",159,"we went into the laboratory and put an end to all we found living"
"13272",159,"there."
"13273",159,""
"13274",159,""
"13275",159,""
"13276",159,""
"13277",159,"XIX."
"13278",159,"MONTGOMERY’S “BANK HOLIDAY.”"
"13279",159,""
"13280",159,""
"13281",159,"When this was accomplished, and we had washed and eaten, Montgomery and"
"13282",159,"I went into my little room and seriously discussed our position for the"
"13283",159,"first time. It was then near midnight. He was almost sober, but greatly"
"13284",159,"disturbed in his mind. He had been strangely under the influence of"
"13285",159,"Moreau’s personality: I do not think it had ever occurred to him that"
"13286",159,"Moreau could die. This disaster was the sudden collapse of the habits"
"13287",159,"that had become part of his nature in the ten or more monotonous years"
"13288",159,"he had spent on the island. He talked vaguely, answered my questions"
"13289",159,"crookedly, wandered into general questions."
"13290",159,""
"13291",159,"“This silly ass of a world,” he said; “what a muddle it all is! I"
"13292",159,"haven’t had any life. I wonder when it’s going to begin. Sixteen years"
"13293",159,"being bullied by nurses and schoolmasters at their own sweet will; five"
"13294",159,"in London grinding hard at medicine, bad food, shabby lodgings, shabby"
"13295",159,"clothes, shabby vice, a blunder,—_I_ didn’t know any better,—and"
"13296",159,"hustled off to this beastly island. Ten years here! What’s it all for,"
"13297",159,"Prendick? Are we bubbles blown by a baby?”"
"13298",159,""
"13299",159,"It was hard to deal with such ravings. “The thing we have to think of"
"13300",159,"now,” said I, “is how to get away from this island.”"
"13301",159,""
"13302",159,"“What’s the good of getting away? I’m an outcast. Where am _I_ to join"
"13303",159,"on? It’s all very well for _you_, Prendick. Poor old Moreau! We can’t"
"13304",159,"leave him here to have his bones picked. As it is—And besides, what"
"13305",159,"will become of the decent part of the Beast Folk?”"
"13306",159,""
"13307",159,"“Well,” said I, “that will do to-morrow. I’ve been thinking we might"
"13308",159,"make the brushwood into a pyre and burn his body—and those other"
"13309",159,"things. Then what will happen with the Beast Folk?”"
"13310",159,""
"13311",159,"“_I_ don’t know. I suppose those that were made of beasts of prey will"
"13312",159,"make silly asses of themselves sooner or later. We can’t massacre the"
"13313",159,"lot—can we? I suppose that’s what _your_ humanity would suggest? But"
"13314",159,"they’ll change. They are sure to change.”"
"13315",159,""
"13316",159,"He talked thus inconclusively until at last I felt my temper going."
"13317",159,""
"13318",159,"“Damnation!” he exclaimed at some petulance of mine; “can’t you see I’m"
"13319",159,"in a worse hole than you are?” And he got up, and went for the brandy."
"13320",159,"“Drink!” he said returning, “you logic-chopping, chalky-faced saint of"
"13321",159,"an atheist, drink!”"
"13322",159,""
"13323",159,"“Not I,” said I, and sat grimly watching his face under the yellow"
"13324",159,"paraffine flare, as he drank himself into a garrulous misery."
"13325",159,""
"13326",159,"I have a memory of infinite tedium. He wandered into a maudlin defence"
"13327",159,"of the Beast People and of M’ling. M’ling, he said, was the only thing"
"13328",159,"that had ever really cared for him. And suddenly an idea came to him."
"13329",159,""
"13330",159,"“I’m damned!” said he, staggering to his feet and clutching the brandy"
"13331",159,"bottle."
"13332",159,""
"13333",159,"By some flash of intuition I knew what it was he intended. “You don’t"
"13334",159,"give drink to that beast!” I said, rising and facing him."
"13335",159,""
"13336",159,"“Beast!” said he. “You’re the beast. He takes his liquor like a"
"13337",159,"Christian. Come out of the way, Prendick!”"
"13338",159,""
"13339",159,"“For God’s sake,” said I."
"13340",159,""
"13341",159,"“Get—out of the way!” he roared, and suddenly whipped out his revolver."
"13342",159,""
"13343",159,"“Very well,” said I, and stood aside, half-minded to fall upon him as"
"13344",159,"he put his hand upon the latch, but deterred by the thought of my"
"13345",159,"useless arm. “You’ve made a beast of yourself,—to the beasts you may"
"13346",159,"go.”"
"13347",159,""
"13348",159,"He flung the doorway open, and stood half facing me between the yellow"
"13349",159,"lamp-light and the pallid glare of the moon; his eye-sockets were"
"13350",159,"blotches of black under his stubbly eyebrows."
"13351",159,""
"13352",159,"“You’re a solemn prig, Prendick, a silly ass! You’re always fearing and"
"13353",159,"fancying. We’re on the edge of things. I’m bound to cut my throat"
"13354",159,"to-morrow. I’m going to have a damned Bank Holiday to-night.” He turned"
"13355",159,"and went out into the moonlight. “M’ling!” he cried; “M’ling, old"
"13356",159,"friend!”"
"13357",159,""
"13358",159,"Three dim creatures in the silvery light came along the edge of the wan"
"13359",159,"beach,—one a white-wrapped creature, the other two blotches of"
"13360",159,"blackness following it. They halted, staring. Then I saw M’ling’s"
"13361",159,"hunched shoulders as he came round the corner of the house."
"13362",159,""
"13363",159,"“Drink!” cried Montgomery, “drink, you brutes! Drink and be men! Damme,"
"13364",159,"I’m the cleverest. Moreau forgot this; this is the last touch. Drink, I"
"13365",159,"tell you!” And waving the bottle in his hand he started off at a kind"
"13366",159,"of quick trot to the westward, M’ling ranging himself between him and"
"13367",159,"the three dim creatures who followed."
"13368",159,""
"13369",159,"I went to the doorway. They were already indistinct in the mist of the"
"13370",159,"moonlight before Montgomery halted. I saw him administer a dose of the"
"13371",159,"raw brandy to M’ling, and saw the five figures melt into one vague"
"13372",159,"patch."
"13373",159,""
"13374",159,"“Sing!” I heard Montgomery shout,—“sing all together, ‘Confound old"
"13375",159,"Prendick!’ That’s right; now again, ‘Confound old Prendick!’”"
"13376",159,""
"13377",159,"The black group broke up into five separate figures, and wound slowly"
"13378",159,"away from me along the band of shining beach. Each went howling at his"
"13379",159,"own sweet will, yelping insults at me, or giving whatever other vent"
"13380",159,"this new inspiration of brandy demanded. Presently I heard Montgomery’s"
"13381",159,"voice shouting, “Right turn!” and they passed with their shouts and"
"13382",159,"howls into the blackness of the landward trees. Slowly, very slowly,"
"13383",159,"they receded into silence."
"13384",159,""
"13385",159,"The peaceful splendour of the night healed again. The moon was now past"
"13386",159,"the meridian and travelling down the west. It was at its full, and very"
"13387",159,"bright riding through the empty blue sky. The shadow of the wall lay, a"
"13388",159,"yard wide and of inky blackness, at my feet. The eastward sea was a"
"13389",159,"featureless grey, dark and mysterious; and between the sea and the"
"13390",159,"shadow the grey sands (of volcanic glass and crystals) flashed and"
"13391",159,"shone like a beach of diamonds. Behind me the paraffine lamp flared hot"
"13392",159,"and ruddy."
"13393",159,""
"13394",159,"Then I shut the door, locked it, and went into the enclosure where"
"13395",159,"Moreau lay beside his latest victims,—the staghounds and the llama and"
"13396",159,"some other wretched brutes,—with his massive face calm even after his"
"13397",159,"terrible death, and with the hard eyes open, staring at the dead white"
"13398",159,"moon above. I sat down upon the edge of the sink, and with my eyes upon"
"13399",159,"that ghastly pile of silvery light and ominous shadows began to turn"
"13400",159,"over my plans. In the morning I would gather some provisions in the"
"13401",159,"dingey, and after setting fire to the pyre before me, push out into the"
"13402",159,"desolation of the high sea once more. I felt that for Montgomery there"
"13403",159,"was no help; that he was, in truth, half akin to these Beast Folk,"
"13404",159,"unfitted for human kindred."
"13405",159,""
"13406",159,"I do not know how long I sat there scheming. It must have been an hour"
"13407",159,"or so. Then my planning was interrupted by the return of Montgomery to"
"13408",159,"my neighbourhood. I heard a yelling from many throats, a tumult of"
"13409",159,"exultant cries passing down towards the beach, whooping and howling,"
"13410",159,"and excited shrieks that seemed to come to a stop near the water’s"
"13411",159,"edge. The riot rose and fell; I heard heavy blows and the splintering"
"13412",159,"smash of wood, but it did not trouble me then. A discordant chanting"
"13413",159,"began."
"13414",159,""
"13415",159,"My thoughts went back to my means of escape. I got up, brought the"
"13416",159,"lamp, and went into a shed to look at some kegs I had seen there. Then"
"13417",159,"I became interested in the contents of some biscuit-tins, and opened"
"13418",159,"one. I saw something out of the tail of my eye,—a red figure,—and"
"13419",159,"turned sharply."
"13420",159,""
"13421",159,"Behind me lay the yard, vividly black-and-white in the moonlight, and"
"13422",159,"the pile of wood and faggots on which Moreau and his mutilated victims"
"13423",159,"lay, one over another. They seemed to be gripping one another in one"
"13424",159,"last revengeful grapple. His wounds gaped, black as night, and the"
"13425",159,"blood that had dripped lay in black patches upon the sand. Then I saw,"
"13426",159,"without understanding, the cause of my phantom,—a ruddy glow that came"
"13427",159,"and danced and went upon the wall opposite. I misinterpreted this,"
"13428",159,"fancied it was a reflection of my flickering lamp, and turned again to"
"13429",159,"the stores in the shed. I went on rummaging among them, as well as a"
"13430",159,"one-armed man could, finding this convenient thing and that, and"
"13431",159,"putting them aside for to-morrow’s launch. My movements were slow, and"
"13432",159,"the time passed quickly. Insensibly the daylight crept upon me."
"13433",159,""
"13434",159,"The chanting died down, giving place to a clamour; then it began again,"
"13435",159,"and suddenly broke into a tumult. I heard cries of, “More! more!” a"
"13436",159,"sound like quarrelling, and a sudden wild shriek. The quality of the"
"13437",159,"sounds changed so greatly that it arrested my attention. I went out"
"13438",159,"into the yard and listened. Then cutting like a knife across the"
"13439",159,"confusion came the crack of a revolver."
"13440",159,""
"13441",159,"I rushed at once through my room to the little doorway. As I did so I"
"13442",159,"heard some of the packing-cases behind me go sliding down and smash"
"13443",159,"together with a clatter of glass on the floor of the shed. But I did"
"13444",159,"not heed these. I flung the door open and looked out."
"13445",159,""
"13446",159,"Up the beach by the boathouse a bonfire was burning, raining up sparks"
"13447",159,"into the indistinctness of the dawn. Around this struggled a mass of"
"13448",159,"black figures. I heard Montgomery call my name. I began to run at once"
"13449",159,"towards this fire, revolver in hand. I saw the pink tongue of"
"13450",159,"Montgomery’s pistol lick out once, close to the ground. He was down. I"
"13451",159,"shouted with all my strength and fired into the air. I heard some one"
"13452",159,"cry, “The Master!” The knotted black struggle broke into scattering"
"13453",159,"units, the fire leapt and sank down. The crowd of Beast People fled in"
"13454",159,"sudden panic before me, up the beach. In my excitement I fired at their"
"13455",159,"retreating backs as they disappeared among the bushes. Then I turned to"
"13456",159,"the black heaps upon the ground."
"13457",159,""
"13458",159,"Montgomery lay on his back, with the hairy-grey Beast-man sprawling"
"13459",159,"across his body. The brute was dead, but still gripping Montgomery’s"
"13460",159,"throat with its curving claws. Near by lay M’ling on his face and quite"
"13461",159,"still, his neck bitten open and the upper part of the smashed"
"13462",159,"brandy-bottle in his hand. Two other figures lay near the fire,—the one"
"13463",159,"motionless, the other groaning fitfully, every now and then raising its"
"13464",159,"head slowly, then dropping it again."
"13465",159,""
"13466",159,"I caught hold of the grey man and pulled him off Montgomery’s body; his"
"13467",159,"claws drew down the torn coat reluctantly as I dragged him away."
"13468",159,"Montgomery was dark in the face and scarcely breathing. I splashed"
"13469",159,"sea-water on his face and pillowed his head on my rolled-up coat."
"13470",159,"M’ling was dead. The wounded creature by the fire—it was a Wolf-brute"

"13475",159,"the Beast People had vanished from the beach."
"13476",159,""

"13482",159,"the setting moon was becoming pale and opaque in the luminous blue of"

"13484",159,""
"13485",159,"Suddenly I heard a thud and a hissing behind me, and, looking round,"

"13490",159,"flames across the sloping straw. A spurt of fire jetted from the window"
"13491",159,"of my room."
"13492",159,""
"13493",159,"I knew at once what had happened. I remembered the crash I had heard."
"13494",159,"When I had rushed out to Montgomery’s assistance, I had overturned the"
"13495",159,"lamp."
"13496",159,""
"13497",159,"The hopelessness of saving any of the contents of the enclosure stared"

"13503",159,"himself upon me and prevent our return to mankind!"
"13504",159,""

"13510",159,"dawn, and then they met mine. The lids fell."
"13511",159,""

"13513",159,"“The last,” he murmured, “the last of this silly universe. What a"
"13514",159,"mess—”"
"13515",159,""

"13535",159,""
"13536",159,"Then out of the bushes came three Beast People, with hunched shoulders,"
"13537",159,"protruding heads, misshapen hands awkwardly held, and inquisitive,"
"13538",159,"unfriendly eyes and advanced towards me with hesitating gestures."

"13540",159,""

"13543",159,"XX."
"13544",159,"ALONE WITH THE BEAST FOLK."
"13545",159,""
"13546",159,""
"13547",159,"I faced these people, facing my fate in them, single-handed"
"13548",159,"now,—literally single-handed, for I had a broken arm. In my pocket was"
"13549",159,"a revolver with two empty chambers. Among the chips scattered about the"

"13553",159,"my eyes, and their quivering nostrils investigated the bodies that lay"
"13554",159,"beyond me on the beach. I took half-a-dozen steps, picked up the"
"13555",159,"blood-stained whip that lay beneath the body of the Wolf-man, and"
"13556",159,"cracked it. They stopped and stared at me."
"13557",159,""
"13558",159,"“Salute!” said I. “Bow down!”"
"13559",159,""
"13560",159,"They hesitated. One bent his knees. I repeated my command, with my"
"13561",159,"heart in my mouth, and advanced upon them. One knelt, then the other"
"13562",159,"two."
"13563",159,""
"13564",159,"I turned and walked towards the dead bodies, keeping my face towards"
"13565",159,"the three kneeling Beast Men, very much as an actor passing up the"
"13566",159,"stage faces the audience."
"13567",159,""
"13568",159,"“They broke the Law,” said I, putting my foot on the Sayer of the Law."
"13569",159,"“They have been slain,—even the Sayer of the Law; even the Other with"
"13570",159,"the Whip. Great is the Law! Come and see.”"
"13571",159,""
"13572",159,"“None escape,” said one of them, advancing and peering."
"13573",159,""
"13574",159,"“None escape,” said I. “Therefore hear and do as I command.” They stood"
"13575",159,"up, looking questioningly at one another."
"13576",159,""
"13577",159,"“Stand there,” said I."
"13578",159,""

"13581",159,"in two chambers, and bending down to rummage, found half-a-dozen"

"13583",159,""

"13586",159,""

"13592",159,""

"13594",159,""
"13595",159,"They went in up to their armpits and stood regarding me."
"13596",159,""

"13598",159,"Something seemed to tighten across my chest."
"13599",159,""

"13605",159,""

"13607",159,""
"13608",159,"They took care not to approach the place where they had thrown"
"13609",159,"Montgomery into the water, but instead, carried the four dead Beast"
"13610",159,"People slantingly along the beach for perhaps a hundred yards before"

"13612",159,""

"13618",159,"little averted."
"13619",159,""
